results.description:
This Event: 

The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where Python developers and learners can come and ask questions or give help. 

Individuals of all programming skill levels are welcome. 

It is suggested that you bring your own laptop. If you don't have access to a laptop and want to attend, please let Paul Logston know and he will see about getting you a laptop for the day.

This event is free. 

This event is not a tutorial. Tutorials hosted by Learn Python NYC are labeled as tutorials.

Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.

results.description:
Join us for our weekly Underwater Rugby (UWR) practice!

Underwater what? Underwater rugby is probably the most exciting activity you may have ever done. The only 3D sport (apart from Harry Potter’s Quidditch), great endurance, fast, strategic, and above all: extreme fun! Imagine a 13ft-deep pool, 2 baskets on the bottom of each side. Two teams, equipped with fins, mask&snorkel, and a salt-water filled ball. We hold our breath when playing at 3, 5, 13 feet below the surface and pass the ball standing on our heads, swimming sideways and swirling around. Yes, we can tackle the person who carries the ball. But no, no one ever drowned in the 60 years the sport has been around. Ladies and gents are equally welcome - we are co-ed :)

We have all the equipment you need if you want to try. Just let us know and jump with us into the water - we welcome all levels (though you should be able to swim and be comfortable with the idea of swimming under the water - but you don't need to be an expert diver). 

So just send us a quick line and new experiences await - we promise!

Contact Daniel or Rolexi at [masked]

And check out our Facebook profile www.facebook.com/NJ.UWH.UWR/

<a href="http://g.co/maps/ueppk"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: 226 Rome Street, Newark, NJ  Map: http://g.co/maps/ueppk

Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we chant and meditate together, together with the beautiful sounds of a gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can at all times.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm on Midchester Ave. -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we meet elsewhere and begin our meeting at 5 pm, followed by an informal potluck social starting about 7 pm.

(When you plan on staying for the potluck, see the log-in information posted at our monthly potluck page. That helps us get healthy, balanced meals.)

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.  We never have only a few members at a meeting. Twenty members more usually attend each meeting.

Call Merrill or Mataji anytime you have questions:[masked]-5334.

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 2:00. We typically start 15 minutes after 2:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

If you're not a coffee drinker, there's also tea and other beverages available, as well as snacks.  The service is great here, too.  You can play with the group or one-on-one, whatever makes you happy!

results.description:
Weather: Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

Get tickets at: http://www.clickmixers.com/paint-and-drink-nyc.html
(No tickets will be sold at venue. You must Pre-Pay online - This event almost always  sells out by the event day so get your tickets now. It's unlikely tickets will still be available by the day of the event)

WHEN: SATURDAY, MARCH 26th, 2:30 to 4:30 PM
WHERE: THE HOUSE OF BREWS - 2ND FL BACK ROOM (302 W 51ST STREET)

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 15 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few more cocktails. You'll get to mingle a bit and make some new friends and also get to enter into a fun raffle for a chance to win a prize!

This event is mostly for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. All ages are welcome to attend.

PICS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

BY THE WAY... YOU DON'T HAVE TO HAVE ANY ARTISTIC ABILITY TO ENJOY THIS EVENT. FOR MANY PEOPLE ATTENDING IT WILL BE THEIR FIRST TIME PAINTING ANYTHING IN YEARS. THE ARTIST WILL WALK YOU THROUGH EVERYTHING STEP BY STEP.

WE RECOMMEND GETTING YOUR TICKET AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AS WE HAVE LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE FOR THIS EVENT AND MANY TIMES IT SELLS OUT.

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend. The RSVP list on this page is only a small portion of actual attendees.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

TICKET PRICE: $39
Get tickets at: http://www.clickmixers.com/paint-and-drink-nyc.html
(No tickets will be sold at venue. You must Pre-Pay online - This event almost always  sells out by the event day so get your tickets now. It's unlikely tickets will still be available by the day of the event)

We will be going over the origins of the world's 2nd most spoken mother tongue (after Chinese) with a brief history beginning from Spain. NOTE: this will be mostly in English

-Origins in Spain: from Latin

-The Arabic Influence on Spanish

-Discussion on language and influence

venue.name: Midtown Manhattan at Unity Jiu Jitsu School

results.description:
The Promise Society (TPS) and New York Asian Women's Center Young Professionals Board (NYAWC YPB) are proud to host a self defense/ self awareness course taught by world class athlete and instructor, Ana Lowry from Unity Jiu Jitsu school.

The art of Ju Jitsu is geared towards improving one's self defense. Many techniques used in Ju Jiitsu are purely technical, requiring barely any strength, and can be used to triumph over much stronger opponents. This self defense course is designed to make you more aware, prepared, and ready for any situation that may occur in your everyday life. Although hopefully you will never be in a situation where you must use these tactics, we hope this course provides helpful tips that are simple, effective and easy to use. Net proceeds from ticket sales will be donated to further the programs of the New York Asian Women's Center. The New York Asian Women’s Center helps women and their children overcome domestic violence and other forms of abuse by empowering them to govern their own lives. The Center provides a safe haven through multi-lingual support programs and shelter services. In addition, the Center works to raise public awareness about violence against women, advocates for the rights of survivors, and acts as an agent of social change. Thanks to Ana Lowry and Unity Jiu Jitsu school in New York for providing the space, time, and instruction to teach us how to protect ourselves in unexpected situations.

FAQs:

What should I wear to the event? What should I bring? Can I change my clothes there? Wear comfortable work out clothes. Shoes are not required for class. There are changing rooms and showers on premises but please come earlier to access this since class will start promptly at 2:30PM. Feel free to bring water to keep yourself hydrated. We will supply snacks after class. How long is the class? The class will be 90 minutes, from 2:30 to 4:00PM, with a post class mingling event from 4:00-5:00PM to allow you to network with NYAWC YPB, TPS and the Unity Jiu Jitsu school staff. The post class event is optional but highly recommended. Who will I be partnered with during class? Please indicate your preference to be partnered with someone of the same gender, opposite gender, or if you'd like to partner with a friend. We will try to honor the request, however, there are other factors that must be considered by the instructor, such as whether the pairing is compatible based on physical build of the students Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? Please e-mail [masked] for any questions on this event. Is my registration/ticket transferrable? refundable? Your ticket is transferrable. Please make sure to update the name on the event brite registration within 72 hours of class. The ticket is not refundable since proceeds from this event will be donated to NYAWC.

All attendees must register via Eventbrite, tickets will include a 90 minute jiu-jitsu class, and post-class snacks from our sponsors. Please RSVP to our event here:

http://defendwithafriend.eventbrite.com/?aff=meetup
results.name: Ju Jitsu Self Defense Class!

results.description:
Every Saturday, join Bhante Suddhāso for a period of meditation followed by a Dhamma Talk at Yoga on the Rocks, in Rockaway Beach.


3PM - 30 min meditation

This Saturday March 26th we will have a special guest, Bhante Saddhasara, to join us.

Bhante Saddhasara joined the Mahamevnawa Meditation Monastery in Sri Lanka in 2005, became a novice in 2006 under Ven. Kiribatgoda Gnanananda Thero, and after two years of study and practice, attained High Ordination in 2009. After three more years of study, he had begun to develop a deep understanding of insight and tranquility techniques. In 2012 he was asked to begin and to organize a meditation center in Tampa, Florida to provide training to all those who wished to learn. The center was to be non-denominational; anyone of any religion could come and study the practices. Bhante Saddhasara also offered a Recovery Program for those suffering from addiction; an introductory mindfulness program for children; a prison program; and, throughout Florida and throughout the U.S.A, he also gave lectures and provided mindfulness and meditation teaching, as well as private counseling to adults and to youths of all ages. Bhante Saddhasara speaks fluent English and very much enjoys the back and forth of his conversations with Americans.
results.name: ROCKAWAY BEACH, NYC: 3pm Meditation with Bhante Suddhāso & Bhante Saddhasara

results.description:
You are invited to join the next meetup.Our meditation meetups are conducted by Dhammakaya meditation instructors, and practitioners who have committed their lives by ordaining to teach meditation and Dhamma(reality of life). They are eager to teach their technique and wisdom on meditation methods, benefits and knowledge gained from meditation, and our true purpose. Every session will be inspiring and will help encourage one to meditate. Though many of us are aware that meditation can help with stress, there is still so much more to learn from the benefits of meditating. We constantly need to be reminded and encouraged to meditate, otherwise it is easy to forget how meditating can be beneficial to our overall well being.

Class Schedule

3:10 Relaxation Exercise

3:30 Guided Meditation / Q&A / Group Discussion

4:30 End of the session

We hope to see you
results.name: Weekly Meditation

results.description:
Cato the Younger (Jean-Baptiste Roman &  François Rude)

In Stoicism, the ideal type of person is called a sage (sapiens). The goal of Stoic practice is to move oneself closer toward sagehood. But did any sages actually exist? And what qualities does a sage have?

In this meetup, we will continue our year of Seneca by exploring his answers to these questions and more in "On The Constancy of the Sage" (De Constantia Sapientis). This text both serves as a fairly good introduction to Stoicism while also offering quite a bit to those who are more familiar with Stoicism's basic tenets.

To prepare for the meetup, please read the text in full. Also, come prepared with at least one concept or passage you would like to discuss in more detail. Finally, please take note of any practices or concepts that Seneca mentions in this text that would be useful to a modern Stoic. 

While you are welcome to use any translation you'd like, there is a quite good translation available for free on Wikisource.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the Stoic flame on the table
results.name: On the Constancy of the Sage (De Constantia Sapientis)

results.description:
The next meeting will go as follows:

Part 1. Teach-in: Process/Model/Expertise discussion. ~20 min presentation w ~20 min Q&A.
Our speaker works in corporate espionage, if you will. Mark Christopher is Senior Director at the Arkin Group, a corporate intelligence and risk advisory firm. He handles the firm's Asia practice, with a focus on financial services clients. His previous experience includes two years at the Council on Foreign Relations, where he specialized in Chinese infrastructure investments in emerging markets, as well as time at the Clinton Foundation HIV/AIDS Initiative in Nigeria, the US-China Business Council, the Congressional-Executive Commission on China, and the Beijing office of the Energy Foundation.

---


Part 2. Long format pitch on CMPR (~20min). Presenter will have poetic license to structure the presentation. However, our suggestion is that the presentation start with the basic introduction of the business/revenue model followed by any special insight/moat description, valuation and downside risks.

Please do independent work on this name, so you are prepare to present bull or bear argument for this name

---


Part 3. Short Format Ideas Discussion:
- 1. Fairfax Holdings
- 2. Signet (SIG)

Please do independent work on names above, so you are prepared to present bull or bear argument for this name

results.description:
The cost for each class is $20.00 which includes 3-6 hours of class time. Includes all the paper supplies needed to create your Make and Take copy of each project and a glass of wine while you learn fun ways to create beautiful handmade card & paper crafting projects.

Just bring your favorite adhesive (tape runner, wet glue and/foam pop up tape.)

Each class will start with a look the samples and a quick rundown of the techniques used for each of the projects for the night.

I will show you step by step how to construct each. In the process you get to "play" with Stampin’ Up! products and learn about many of the tools and supplies that are used in the world of card making and paper crafting.

You get a supplies sheet listing the sizes & dimensions of the project, stamp sets, dies and tools used during the class and an Exclusive YT web address to a video demo of the class' projects only class attendees can access (videos stay exclusive for 1 year).

TENTATIVE THEMES FOR 2016

• January's Classes: Love(Valentine's Day) / Wet Embossing & Coloring

• February's Classes: Springtime(Easter) / Interactive Cards

• March's Classes: Birthdays & Special Days / Layers & Punches

• April's Classes: Just Because / Multi-Step Stamping & Backgrounds

• May's Classes: Congratulations(Graduations & Weddings) / Fancy Folds

• June's Classes: Thinking of You / Inking & Stencils

• July's Classes: Any Occasion / Dry Embossing

• August's Classes: Back to School / Non-traditional sizes & Easels

• September's Classes: Spooky Fun(Halloween) / Die Cutting

• October's Classes: Family Gatherings(Thanksgiving) / Using Punches

• November's Classes: Holiday Wishes(Christmas/Hanukkah) / Shakers

• December's Classes: Inspirational(New Year) / Monochromatic White

* Each Class (same theme/design) will be held 2 times a month. SATURDAY AND/OR SUNDAY

** Class will be cancelled if there are less than 3 participants or for personal emergency.

*** Please make sure you are subscribed to organizer's messages.

Need more information or would like to suggest a theme or project... please feel free to send me a message.

results.description:
Prepay here:

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=5VJYJEKM4K9NN

=============================================

The Lower East Side, once known as a gritty neighborhood for "new" immigrants, has evolved into an epicenter for daring and provocative art. Come see the ongoing transformation of this old village of housing projects, tenements and synagogues - now home to over 100 galleries! Our itinerary will include up to 10 selected ones, with exclusive talks by owners and staff that will give us greater insight into the exhibits.

The tour will be led by Savona Bailey-McClain, founder and executive director of the West Harlem Art Fund, an organization that promotes art and culture in parks and other open spaces across NYC, as well as galleries. She has been involved in numerous public art installations and was recently selected to join TINA, a new international network for contemporary art curators based in Italy. In addition, she hosts "State of the Arts NYC", a weekly radio program airing Fridays on WBAI, 99.5 FM.

IMPORTANT:

- Prepay here:

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=5VJYJEKM4K9NN

- If you tried to use the above link but had trouble with Paypal, an alternate payment link on Brown Paper Tickets will be emailed upon request. This will require an extra $1 charge to help cover the higher fees with this processor.

- On March 25 (one day before), the price will go up to $25 if the event has not sold out. Purchasing your spot as early as possible is recommended.

- RSVP without payment does NOT reserve your spot or lock in the price.

- Online payment deadline is 10:30am on the day of the tour.

- If space is available, payment can be made on-site ($25, cash only).

- Sorry, refunds and exchanges are not available (unless the event is cancelled). However, if you are unable to attend, you can send someone in your place. At check-in, simply have him or her mention the name under which you paid.

- If you are late or having trouble finding the group, send "old-fashioned" text only to (917) 680-0656. This is not a smartphone and has no Internet access, so emailing, posting comments on this page, or sending messages through the Meetup site (or app) will NOT work. Also, no voice calls please, as they can be extremely disruptive.

- Please remember to bring photo ID in case it is requested by security at some of the galleries.

- Feel free to bring your camera.  Taking pictures is allowed.

- The tour will last approximately one and a half hours. Afterward, we will go somewhere nearby for food and socializing if there is interest.

- Gratuities are welcomed.

- Art novices are welcome, as are people with extensive art backgrounds.

- This event is exclusively for members of my meetup groups and their guests, plus special invitees.  It is not open to the general public.

- Please note that the "+ xx" next to my name on the attendance list to the right is a best estimate of total attendees from outside this group, manually updated every 12-48 hours.  It is NOT an arbitrary number. However, also remember that the number of "no-shows" can never be accurately predicted.


See you there!

Milton & Savona
results.how_to_find_us: Take the F/J/M/Z to Delancey-Essex, walk 2 blocks west on Delancey, turn left onto Orchard. Or take the B/D to Grand Street, exit at Chrystie, walk 4 blocks east on Grand, turn left onto Orchard and continue 2 blocks.

results.description:
Join us for figure drawing session in Ukrainian Village.


This meetup is open to sketchers of all levels. 

Why are we different? 


• Large, well lit, and quiet space on a second floor of a secure building. 

•[masked] minute poses. Model takes a break every 20 min.

• Latecomers are ok.

• Mingle, look at each other's work during the break and get inspired. Nobody will judge you. All levels and drawing styles are welcome and your artistry is appreciated.

How it works?

• We draw for 3 hours from a live (nude) model.  

• We warm up with 5 minute poses and work all the way up to 20 minute poses by the end. Model takes 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 

• There are seats for everyone at the tables. 

• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• BYOM - Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint or sprays).

Entrance to our building:

If you have any questions please feel free to email me. I'm looking forward to meeting you there. 


Phillip
results.how_to_find_us: We are in Manhattan (2nd Ave at 13th St)
results.name: Life Figure Drawing - Ukrainian Village

results.description:
There is a class at the Brooklyn Public Library on pacific street on graphic animation and photographs. It’s kind of like a photoshop class but Andrea Richards will be teaching Blender instead. 


What is Blender?

Blender is a professional free and open-source 3D computer graphics software product used for creating animated films, visual effects, art, 3D printed models, interactive 3D applications and video games.

Blender's features include 3D modeling, UV unwrapping, texturing, raster graphics editing, rigging and skinning, fluid and smoke simulation, particle simulation, soft body simulation, sculpting, animating, camera tracking, rendering, video editing and compositing. Alongside the modeling features it also has an integrated game engine.

register here https://www.eventbrite.com/e/learn-blender-basics-tickets-23017468869
results.name: Learn Blender Basics

results.description: Stressed from the pressures of work, family, and relationships? We were born pure, without the influence of others. We were taught what not to do and what we should do from our parents, our friends, our society, our religion .... so much that we have forgotten who we are. In this guided meditation and workshop, you will learn how to begin to connect with who you truly are, your wants & needs and how to find authentic, genuine love.
results.name: Guided Meditation & Energy Therapy

results.description:
Top of the morn'in everypony! Lyrish eyes are shining bright on you this fine day, for soon we'll be back at our old battlements but in a brand new spot watching brand new episodes! How awesome is that?

https://goo.gl/KXx4c9

The sixth season, once thought to be rarer than a six leaf clover, is barreling down the track - and we've got to be ready for the big premiere, which comes in like a lion - but out like an Alicorn?


So we found the city's finest theatre, and the city's finest folks to put on the best show possible- Join us at the Harlem repertory Theatre on 123rd street, you'll find a whole lot more awaits ye than just a new episode!

http://goo.gl/Rlk7hl

^New space to fill with the Lucky Lyrish 

Well first you've got your friends, then we have some pony programming sure to bring out the green in you:

-Screening the Season 6 Premiere! 

-Check out the Barncade Emulator Paradise! Lots and lots of classic video games across lots and lots of TV's -  take on competitors in multiplayer madness or go it alone on a solo quest! We have most games from the late 1970's through the mid 90s.

-Pokken Tournament
     Organizeded by Geeligan Stache

- The tournament will have a total of 16 players
- The tournament will only take place in Basic Battles
- Any Pokemon Fighters, Support Pokemon, Cheer Skill and Stage can be chosen
-The match's will be best 2 out of 3 and you can be able to change fighters, support, Cheer Skill and Stage in between rounds
(players must choose change Pokemon in order to change their fighters,Support,Cheer skill,etc.)
- In the finals it will be best 3 out of 5 rounds
- Skill set will be off and the rounds and time will be set to it's original default settings along with health

This free workshop and discussion is about an essential element of human nature that can be increasingly difficult to find nowadays--unless you know how to! This element of human nature is a sense of connection!

We will have great workshop exercises, proven via experience of experts, to help you build meaningful connections that goes beyond superficiality. Learn how to relate and open up to others in a way that you have not before, and have them reciprocate.

We will also discuss what is human connection in today's world, where people feel like they have to hide their true natures.

Let's explore the Met together every other Saturday with as little pressure as possible.

Go in the 81st entrance (not up the big stairs), and head straight back to the Uris Center for Education. We'll be at the set of benches (#8) in the middle on the left inside the room. At 4:15pm we will split up.

We'll decide who will go see what with whom, wander galleries, and meet at the north entrance to the Balcony Bar at 5:30pm for cocktails, mocktails, and small plates to chat. We'll get tables at 5:40pm.

Everyone is responsible for their own admission and tab. I recommend you bring cash for your tab to make settling the check easier.

Please join us for this week's sit at 4pm this afternoon at B'nai Keshet (99 South Fullerton Avenue, Montclair), where a small but dedicated group is practicing mindfulness meditation in a Jewish context every Shabbat. There is a beauty and peacefulness when we sit together as a group and support each other's ability to practice.  


The sit leaders alternate each week.  


We frequently begin with a chant, followed by two separate sits with kavvanot (intentions) inspired by the calendar, the weekly Torah portion or our daily lives. All are welcome and there is no cost to attend. We look forward to seeing you. more information at: http://www.jmcmontclair.com

results.description:
Looking to transition soon from meetup so follow and join our facebook page for updates on the group, art relating to the theme, and more at https://www.facebook.com/groups/ImaginativeIllustratorsNYC/ 

Today we will be focused and immersive in a specific theme we will work on together as a group.

In today's challenge we will be drawing our own original superheros and supervillains. We may either draw our hero and the villain they would fight or try something interesting and maybe fun in which we have teams were one member draws the hero and another member the villain that would combat this certain hero vice versa. 

The meetup will be split into three parts: First a half hour of warm-up drawings followed by a break of conceptual discussion, then after an hour and a half drawing your chosen idea and design, lastly we'll discuss each others fully developed drawings and ideas as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused! Also feel free to bring any reference material that will help out with the theme in addition to what will be provided.

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising, challenging, or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC. Any skill level and any style is welcomed!

results.description:
Welcome!

If you love to play basketball, but height is not your advantage, come out and play with people who aren't excessively tall! In the tradition of Spud Webb, anyone under 5'8", male or female, is welcome to join us on the court. We'll get some teams together and play some competitive, but relaxed bball-- and without any giant hands in our faces! :-p

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we must be out of the gym no later than 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

Don't forget:


* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* To be eligible to play we ask that you sign an annual waiver, which can be found here.


* If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers a message. 

The Rules:

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 

6. Usually each team has 1-2 subs. Subs should enter mid-game (one of the teams reaches 6 points) and should start the following game. Teams can regulate themselves but let's just make sure everyone plays!

See you on the court! B-)

***SPECIAL NOTES***

Please do not show up unannounced (without RSVP):

This gym is small and 22 is the maximum number of players we can realistically allow. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. If you do show up unannounced we will have to ask you to leave. 

Refund Policy:

A refund/credit is available if you change your RSVP at least 24 hours in advance OR, if you change your RSVP within 24 hours, as long as you post a comment on the event page and someone picks up your spot (BOTH are required).

Lastly...

Feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your fingernails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.

The Afterparty: 

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later!
results.name: Indoor bball warm up & pickup games

results.description:
The samba for beginners’ class starts with a 30-minute warm up that exercises basic isolation of the body, following by stretching and strengthening exercises. After the warm up, Danielle introduces the students samba no pé (basic samba step) and passo marcado (simple choreographies) typical of the Rio Carnival. The whole class happens in the sound of the upbeat and irresistible Brazilian music.

The class will be held on Saturday from 5-6:30pm and costs $18.

Come with comfortable clothes and be prepared to be barefoot.

About the instructor:

Danielle Lima was born in Rio de Janeiro and grew up performing with Beija-Flor de Nilópolis, one of Brazil’s most famous samba schools. Danielle Lima is also a Certified Teachers Artist of the program Dancing Classrooms from American Ballroom Theater, Certified YOGA Instructor at YOGA Effects in NYC and Karma Kids Yoga certified teacher.

For more information, contact Danielle Lima daniellelima13@ hotmail.com.
results.name: Samba for Beginners

results.description:
The BIG question: Why are you here in this world? Are each of us here to serve in one, perhaps multiple capacities? Others none? Whom are you here to serve and in what areas? How do you do it? How will you do it? And most importantly....to what end(s)???? What are some reasons you believe we are all in this world, today, here, in 2016? Please take the time leading up to Saturday's meetup to think these over, bring your curiosities and all inquiries that relate to the subject. All attending will be contributing to the conversation in some shape or form.

Note: this is not a support group for those sad or depressed as there are other domains set up for that purpose. Please do not attend if you feel or rationalize that others somehow have the responsibility of cheering you up, directly or indirectly.

A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

Look for our red Meetup Sign.

The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

<a href="http://internal.psychology.illinois.edu/%7Eediener/Documents/Kesebir-Diener_2008.pdf">In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
</a>


The BIG question: Why are you here in this world? Are each of us here to serve in one, perhaps in multiple capacities? Others none? Whom are you here to serve and in what areas? How do you do it? How will you do it? And most importantly....to what end(s)???? What are some reasons you believe we are all in this world, today, here, in 2016? Please take the time leading up to Saturday's meetup to think these over, bring your curiosities and all inquiries that relate to the subject. All attending will be contributing to the conversation in some shape or form.

Note: this is not a support group for those sad or depressed as there are other domains set up for that purpose. Please do not attend if you feel or rationalize that others somehow have the responsibility of cheering you up, directly or indirectly.

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/Conversations-New-York/events/219754221/">A Conversation About Happiness

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.


What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.


Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.


Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind!
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty-five years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in courts throughout the country, with his office in Long Island, and his concentration in securities and derivative litigation.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.

results.description:
Please join me for the March gathering of Dining for Women Program. Information on this month's program is below. We'll each bring a dish to share, meet old and new friends, and learn about the Dining for Women Giving Circle as well as the charity for the month. As we "dine in" together and share discussions about universal women's concerns, we can feel empowered by our donations to programs helping impoverished women working to improve their lives!  Please RSVP and bring something yummy to eat or drink. Remember, Dining for Women is changing the world one dinner at a time. See you then! 


CHANGING THE WORLD ONE WOMAN, ONE GIRL, ONE DINNER AT A TIME

Dining for Women is a global giving circle that funds grassroots programs working in developing countries to fight gender inequality. Dining for Women celebrates the power of the individual to see an injustice and act to change it; to see need and act to fill it. Dining for Women’s members are deeply involved in the programs we support and the problems we seek to address. Our education component is equally as important as our fundraising. To learn more about diningforwomen.org please visit their website. 


*****************************************************************************

March Program: Program Title: New Mothers Education Project

Location: Jalapa, Nicaragua

Program Website: www.aaccchildren.org

Areas of Impact: Education, Gender Equality, Health

Mission of Americas Association For the Care of Children (AACC)
To reduce the impact of poverty on marginalized populations through compassionate, holistic education to enable: 1) empowerment of primary caregivers, 2) nutritional adequacy and preventative healthcare, 3) special needs therapeutic support, and 4) sustainable community and economic development.

Program Summary
AACC will provide a training program that certifies ten women residing in/near Jalapa, Nicaragua as ongoing trainers providing education on prenatal care, labor and delivery, breastfeeding, the new mother’s health, nutrition, and infant development in the first year of life.

Why We Love This Project
We love this project because of its focus on reducing maternal and child mortality in isolated communities of Jalapa, Nicaragua. By providing trained healthcare workers and education to under-resourced communities, AACC is furthering the reach of health services, supporting mothers and vulnerable newborns and allowing women and girls in these communities opportunities to improve the economic outlook for their families.

results.description:
Discover the Benefits of Buddhist Meditation with a Real Buddhist Monk 

Have you ever wanted to meditate but don’t know where to start? Do you have an interest in Buddhist teachings but wanted to learn from a live human being rather than Wikipedia? Buddhist monk and teacher Bhante Saddhasara is excited to be able to offer bi-weekly meditation and discussion sessions that will help you reduce your level of stress and bring you a peace of mind which is sadly lacking for most of us living in the urban jungle. 

Whether you have absolutely zero experience with meditation or Buddhism or are a seasoned pro, come and join us every Saturday at 06:00pm for a short meditation and discussion session. This Meetup is offered free of charge as a gift of the Dhamma (the Teaching of the Buddha) so please come and invite your friends. Wishing you every good blessing along your path and we hope to see you at our next get together! 

About Bhante Saddhasara 

Bhante Saddhasara joined the Mahamevnawa Meditation Monastery in Sri Lanka in 2005, became a novice in 2006 under Ven. Kiribatgoda Gnanananda Thero, and after two years of study and practice, attained High Ordination in 2009. After three more years of study, he had begun to develop a deep understanding of insight and tranquility techniques. In 2012 he was asked to begin and to organize a meditation center in Tampa, Florida to provide training to all those who wished to learn. The center was to be non-denominational; anyone of any religion could come and study the practices. Bhante Saddhasara also offered a Recovery Program for those suffering from addiction; an introductory mindfulness program for children; a prison program; and, throughout Florida and throughout the U.S.A, he also gave lectures and provided mindfulness and meditation teaching, as well as private counseling to adults and to youths of all ages. Bhante Saddhasara speaks fluent English and very much enjoys the back and forth of his conversations with Americans.
results.name: Join Us for Guided Meditation and Discussion with Bhante Saddhasara!

results.description:
Messiah of Evil:

This enigmatic, artsy horror film from the early 1970's is a lost classic waiting to be rediscovered. The dreamlike storyline echoes elements of Night Of The Living Dead and Carnival Of Souls but manages to chart a surrealistic course all its own, carefully weaving shocks into its hazy mood to build a very personalized sort of nightmare feel. Marianna Hill and Michael Greer offer subtle, nicely stylized performances, both slowly sliding from self-possessed cool into numb fear in a believable style. There are also effective character turns by Elisha Cook, Jr. as a drunk whose ramblings serve as an early warning of the horrors to come and Bennie Robinson's supremely unnerving turn as an otherworldly agent of the evil that infects the film's small-town setting. However, the most distinctive aspect of Messiah Of Evil is its striking visual design: Jack Fisk's production design is dazzling, with the nightmarish pop-art look of the artist's home being the highlight of his work here, and Stephen Katz's crisp widescreen lensing effectively deploys the kind of eerie, primary-colored lighting that genre fans usually associate with Italian horror films. First-time director Willard Huyck (better known for writing scripts for George Lucas with co-writer Gloria Katz) does a fine job of mixing all these distinctive to create a uniquely Californian variant on its gothic horror inspirations. In short, Messiah Of Evil is a macabre little gem and a must for any fan of 1970's horror.

Darktown Strutters:

New World Pictures released some unusual films in an attempt to corner the exploitation market's whims during its history - but Darktown Strutters definitely takes the cake. George Armitage's script mixes barbed social commentary, slapstick comedy, action and free-form craziness to create a thoroughly unpredictable storyline. Director William Witney has fun with the material, getting the most out of some bizarre Jack Fisk-designed sets and maintaining a machine-gun pace to keep up with story's manic, unpredictable style. Trina Parks makes a suitably statuesque heroine and shows some nice comic timing while Roger Mosley lends nice support as the gang leader who acts as her second banana. There's also a scene-stealing turn from Norman Bartold as the Colonel Sanders-styled villain. The resulting film may be too frenetic and odd for a lot of viewers but exploitation film fans who can tune in to its odd wavelength will find Darktown Strutters to be a fast-paced and highly original slab of b-movie ephemera.


A tough biker gang comprised of African-American women heads off to find a member's mother and her abductor in this exploitation comedy ostensibly designed to make fun of racial stereotypes.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=36nKCu1CkJ0

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Oi3TKozz7EY

results.description:
Hey everyone! I started an event called Kitchen Clash, a vibrant, NYC-based supper club where house party meets cooking competition. A group of about 50 guests gather in a swanky, secret location in the heart of city to watch two chefs duke it out for the title of Kitchen Clash Winner. Guests enjoy creative, mouth-watering dishes from our esteemed chefs, an open bar, and the company of a diverse group of eager, fun-loving foodies. Our inaugural event was in September and was a huge success—we raised money for a local non-profit, and everyone had a blast.  This time, we will be donating a portion of the proceeds to The Knowledge House.  

Our next event is coming up in March, and I would love to invite you all to experience it with us. Tickets are $57 dollars. Use the code "clash" to get $5 off. There are only 42 tickets available and we sold out last time.

Check out details here: http://www.thekitchenclash.com/#!event-march-26th/okenv

results.description:
As part of our outreach to T.O.O.O.L.(The Open Organization Of LockPickers}, we are sponsoring a monthly Lockpicking event to encourage like minded individuals to gather, greet, and pick the night away!!!  No experience required, just a desire to learn is all that is needed.  Anyone can learn to pick, if you don't believe us, come on down to MakerBar and try it for yourself!

At this time, we are also requesting donations of locks, ...old rusty pad locks(or shiny new ones), door locks (old or shiny[we love shiny locks]), combination locks, handcuffs (with or without keys), prison shackles(no questions asked...wink, wink), practice locks, bicycle locks, key safes, combination safes, etc... in general anything that has a lock may be donated.   If you have any of the above mentioned locks, and would be happy to donate them, please bring them with you when you come to help increase the diversity of locks to pick.

Come have a beer (or two[we don't count]) with us, and have fun picking away with fellow pickers!! See you there!!

***As Always we remind newcomers to follow the two Golden Rules of Lock-Sport.....

1. Do Not Pick A Lock Without the Owners Consent (Your Neighbors Lock..No Good..)

2. Do Not Pick A Lock You Rely On.(Your house lock would fall into this category.)

Happy Picking!!!!***

**Open to the Public**


In parallel with OPEN CRAFT NIGHT:

Come on down and make stuff! Don't be shy, we love seeing new faces and meeting new MakerBarbians. Bring a project in any state, an idea, or just  come to hang out with us while we work on projects, WARNING spontaneous brainstorms are on the forecast.

This event is free and open to the public.   It is an ideal time to stop in and see what the MakerBar is all about. Doors open at 7PM

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.

http://www.makerbar.com

twitter: @MakerBar

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TheMakerBar

Note: This is a Cabaret Concert, tickets must be purchased in addition to your RSVP. Actual event starts at 7:30pm, please be on time! Tickets are $25 in advance or $30 at the door. This is a public event, it is not exclusive to our meetup group. 

Purchase Tickets here: 
http://www.nycharities.org/events/EventLevels.aspx?ETID=8790

Cabaret Concert - "Vienna to Weimar"

International singing stars KT Sullivan and Karen Kohler take the audience on a journey through the operettas of 1870s Vienna to 1930s Berlin cabaret.Lush Viennese sentimentality gives way to the hard-edged - and chillingly prescient - cynicism of the gritty Weimar cabaret scene.

From Karen Kohler (member of our group):

KT Sullivan and I are thrilled to bring our award-winning cabaret show "Vienna to Weimar" back to the NY stage, this time to the historic Union Temple in downtown Brooklyn. Our timeless songs written in Germany in the 20s and 30s about love, war, peace, gay rights, and women's rights are more trenchant than ever. Hope to see you there!

From their recent press release:

"[...]On Saturday, March 26, international cabaret singing stars KT Sullivan (who is the Artistic Director of the Mabel Mercer Foundation) and Brooklyn-resident Karen Kohler (a multiple cabaret award-winner) will present their celebrated and Award-winning show Vienna to Weimar. The show’s Musical Director/Pianist is Jed Distler. Show time is 7:30 pm at the Union Temple Third Floor Social Hall and tickets for the event will be $25 ($30 at door). 

In Vienna to Weimar, Sullivan and Kohler take the audience on a journey through 1870s Vienna, Austria and the operettas of Johann Strauss and Franz Lehar to 1930s Berlin, Germany and the cabaret music of Friedrich Hollaender, Kurt Weill, Bertolt Brecht, Mischa Spoliansky, Leonard Cohen, and more. With their provocative blend of voices and feminine sensibilities, Sullivan and Kohler offer compelling interpretations of the Great American and European songbooks and prove that love, lust, power, and illusion are as timeless today as they were nearly 100 years ago. 

Vienna to Weimar won the 2012 BroadwayWorld.com New York Cabaret Award for “Best Revue” and Sullivan and Kohler were nominated for a 2013 Manhattan Association of Cabarets and Clubs Award for “Major Duo/Group.” During 2012, the show played to sold-out houses at Stage 72 (Triad Theater) in New York and Crazy Coqs in London and received rave reviews: 

“You had the feeling that [Sullivan and Kohler] could take on the world. As long as they stood together, men, even Attila the Hun, were dispensable . . . lubricious amusement . . . a guilty pleasure . . . cushy Viennese sentimentality gives way to hard-edged Brecht-Weill cynicism in much harsher times." --The New York Times

“A cleverly-structured and enthrallingly entertaining revue that will transport you into the politically infused and sexually steamy period of pre-World War II Austria and Germany, when life and art really was a cabaret . . . Kohler’s alto to mezzo voice is lush while Sullivan’s soprano soars . . . This show is what cabaret can be all about . . . a tour-de-force performance. Wunderbar! --BroadwayWorld.com [...]"

New York Times review:

http://www.nytimes.com/2012/10/22/arts/music/vienna-to-weimar-k-t-sullivan-and-karen-kohler-at-triad.html?_r=0


How do I get there by train?

2/3: Eastern Parkway Brooklyn Museum - 2 blocks
Q: 7th Avenue - 6 Blocks
(Bus: B45 to St John's Pl / Washington Ave - 3 Blocks)

Please check for MTA's current SATURDAY schedule to make sure your bus/train will be running.


Here again the link to register and buy tickets:

http://www.nycharities.org/events/EventLevels.aspx?ETID=8790

results.description:
Dear Dharma Drink Friends,

There is a good event benefiting the earthquake victims in Nepal.  Ani Choying Drolma is a Nepalese Buddhist nun renowned for her numerous humanitarian efforts.  She sings worldwide to support her charitable activities.

7:15pm - 7:45pm - Meet and greet by the Cafe in lobby

8:00pm - Concert

"Internationally acclaimed for her simply stunning interpretations of Buddhist mantras and songs,  ANI CHOYING DROLMA will present sublime blend of traditional Tibetan Buddhist chants and songs from the Himalayas, which will draw the complex mix of devotion, confidence and raw emotion to present a rare musical treat that is authentic and straight from the heart... "


You can RSVP here but please make sure to purchase your tickets directly. Tickets are $25 - $100.       https://kupferbergcenter.showare.com/eventperformances.asp?evt=197

For anyone who like to join us prior to the show, we will be at the Kupferberg Center's Cafe in the lobby hanging out and mingling.  

_/|\_

Eddie

Info on Ani Choying Drolma - http://www.theanifoundation.org/ani.html

-----  This is in Queens College so there is a commute ------

-----  TRANSPORTATION -------

BY CAR:


From Long Island and Points East: Take the LIE westbound; watch for QC signs. If you need to get to the main gate on Kissena, get off at Exit 24 (Kissena Boulevard). Make a left at the light and take overpass onto Kissena Boulevard. If you want on-campus parking, get off at Exit 23, turn left onto Main Street overpass. Watch for QC signs to Kupferberg parking.

From Manhattan and Points West: Take the LIE eastbound; watch for QC signs. Get off at Exit 24 (Kissena Boulevard). If you need the main gate, continue down the service road until the first traffic light (Kissena Boulevard). Make a right onto Kissena. If you want on-campus parking, watch for signs for Kupferberg parking as soon as you exit the LIE. Do not go to traffic light.

Approximate travel time from Midtown Manhattan: 30 minutes


BY PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION:

SUBWAYS
Via Flushing: Take the Long Island Railroad or the #7 subway to Main Street, Flushing. From Main Street, take the Q25, Q25-34, Q34 or Q17 bus.

Via Forest Hills: Take the E, F, G, or R subway to the 71st and Continental Avenue in Forest Hills. Take the exit marked “North side 70 Ave and 108 St.” At the corner, take the Q64 bus to Kissena Boulevard and Jewel Avenue. Stops one block south of campus.

Via Jamaica: Take the F subway to Parsons Boulevard or the LIRR to the Jamaica Station. From Jamaica Avenue and 160th Street or Hillside Avenue and Parsons Boulevard, take the Q25, Q25-34, or Q34 bus. From Hillside Avenue and either 169th or 179th Street, take the Q17 bus to the LIE and Kissena Boulevard.

Approximate travel time from Midtown Manhattan: 60 minutes

BUS LINES
Q25-34 Runs from Main Street, Flushing (#7 subway and LIRR stations), along Kissena (stops at the main gate) and Parsons Boulevards to Jamaica Avenue and 160th Street (BMT and IND).

Q44 Runs from West Farms Square, Bronx (IRT) to Sutphin Boulevard, Jamaica (LIRR station). Stops at Main Street and Melbourne Avenue, two blocks west of campus.

Q64 Runs from Continental Avenue, Forest Hills (IND), along Jewel Avenue to 164th Street. Stops one block from campus.

Q17 Runs from Main Street, Flushing (#7 subway and LIRR stations), to 165th Street terminal in Jamaica (passing the IND 179th Street station). Travels along Kissena Boulevard, LIE service road, 188th Street, and Hillside Avenue. Stops at Kissena and the LIE, two blocks from the main gate.

Q88 Runs from Springfield Boulevard and Union Turnpike along Springfield to 73rd Avenue; along (or west on) 73rd Avenue to 188th Street; along 188th Street to the LIE; along LIE service road to Queens Boulevard and Woodhaven Boulevard. Stops at Kissena Boulevard and the LIE, two blocks from the main gate.

Approximate travel time from Midtown Manhattan: 60 minutes

7:15: Pizza, Drinks and music from DJ Brunchy Brunch in the back area
8:00 pm: Showtime

AGE 21+

Khalid
results.name: W. Village: Free Pizza and Headlining Comedians at BIG Saturday

group.name: FREE or inexpensive things to do in New York City

results.description:
Jersey City's SunMoon Yoga is hosting an AromaFlow Yoga class on March 26th from 7:30-9:30pm. Cost is $20 and you need to pre-register :) Click the link here to sign up!

What is AromaFlow? : Like Yoga, Essential Oils are thousands of years old and have been tied with Yoga in ancient India. Early yogis prized these oils “Attars” for their ability to calm the mind and enhance meditation. When paired with your yoga session, Pure Essential Oils can enhance and deepen your practice. The scents and applications of essential oils are transmitted on a molecular level directly to the part of your brain that controls emotional response and memory. Essential Oils also help the practitioner with balance, energy, and deep relaxation.

Class Description : Class begins with a short centering. From there you will be lead through a sequence of asanas with gentle pauses of Essential Oil applications, concluding the session with a blissful relaxation and meditation.

Who can participate? : Whether you are a beginning yogi or have been in practice for a while, this class is to enhance any level of your yogic experience.

I would like to take the class! : Class fee is $20. 

What should I bring or wear?: Wear comfortable clothing. Consider layers to put on or take off for your temperature comforts. If you have a Yoga mat bring it with you, if not, there are some Yoga mats at the studio for rent.
results.name: Essential Oil Yoga Therapy

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by over a dozen different Singles groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending. 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

$15 prepay only

Pre-Pay here https://nysnmixmatch.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

This event is a combination of a Match Live event and Speed Dating.  Join over 100 fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss.

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and number..

-You will also be given a sheet where you can keep track of everyone you meet.

-We will have several ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night write down the names and the numbers of the people that you met and would like to see again.  You will then hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

-Drink specials -Ice Breaker games with prizes -Full menu is available -Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  You may also bring a non single wing person who will be identified by pairs of wings.

What are the age ranges? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.
results.name: Singles Mix, Mingle & Happy Hour - Over 125 prepaid

results.description:
Join 100+ members already prepaid for this fun singles party. Mix and mingle with other single Meetup members and find your match! It's a great way to connect and one of the friendliest and most social events you will experience!   

This event is a combination of a Match Live event and Speed Dating. We'll have different games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people there in a friendly & flirty way.  

The atmosphere is casual and relaxed so you can interact with others at the party without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene.  

*GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Mar-26-2016_at_0800PM

*PREPAY ONLY ($15, goes up to $20 as date gets closer) No tix sold at door. 

Here is how it works: 

• Upon arrival you'll receive a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches. 

• We'll have several ice breaker games during the night where you'll get to meet others and write down the code names & numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

• At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

What to expect: 

• Comp Appetizers (8-9pm)

• Drink Specials All Night!

• Ice Breaker Games

• Prizes & Giveaways

• Music played at conversational levels

No tickets sold at door. GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Mar-26-2016_at_0800PM

Can I come alone? Yes 90% of those attending will be coming solo. But you can also invite single friends to join you or bring a non-single wing person. Everyone must have a ticket to enter.  

Is this age/ethnic specific? No but will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  It is not meant to be ethnic specific or completely gender balanced. There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

Is there a dress code? No specific dress code. We just suggest "neat casual".

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  We expect 100+ members to attend. 

MUST PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Mar-26-2016_at_0800PM

• Upon arrival you'll receive a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches. 

• We'll have several ice breaker games during the night where you'll get to meet others and write down the code names & numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

• At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

What to expect: 

• Comp Appetizers (8-9pm)

• Drink Specials All Night!

• Ice Breaker Games

• Prizes & Giveaways

• Music played at conversational levels

No tickets sold at door. GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Mar-26-2016_at_0800PM

Can I come alone? Yes 90% of those attending will be coming solo. But you can also invite single friends to join you or bring a non-single wing person. Everyone must have a ticket to enter.  

Is this age/ethnic specific? No but will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  It is not meant to be ethnic specific or completely gender balanced. There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

Is there a dress code? No specific dress code. We just suggest "neat casual".

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  We expect 100+ members to attend. 

MUST PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Mar-26-2016_at_0800PM

ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Beautiful Turf Field - Friendly but competitive game. 

RSVP's open 6 Days before the Meetup at 8:00pm - 


RSVP's close at 6:00pm the night of the game

Main goal is the have fun, play hard, and have a good time. 

Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side; rotating new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $4.00 for the night - Payment will be taken at Half-Time. Please have cash available to pay. If you do not have cash, please go to the ATM prior the game. All players will receive a 1-time exception.
results.how_to_find_us: Park is right off of Kent Ave + N 10th St. - (L) Bedford Ave, or (G) Nassau Ave
results.name: Full-Field Soccer - Co-ed - 11 v 11 - Large Goals

results.description:
You may attend this service on your own and join the group following the mass.


The Easter Vigil liturgy is the most beautiful liturgy in the Roman Catholic Church. This walks through the Easter Vigil, and includes the words to the Exsultet.

Although celebrated Holy Saturday evening, it is the dramatic Easter vigil liturgy that marks the beginning of Easter. We are awaiting our master's return with our lamps full and burning, so that he will find us awake and seat us at his table (cf. Luke 12:35ff). All Catholics should try to attend this beautiful service. The vigil is divided into four parts:

Service of Light, Liturgy of the Word, Liturgy of Baptism, and Liturgy of the Eucharist.

Following mass meet the group on the steps of the church
results.name: Easter Vigil at Holy Trinity

results.description:
The Machine, America’s top Pink Floyd show, has forged a 25 year reputation of excellence, extending the legacy of Pink Floyd. The New York based band focuses on making every show an authentic Floydian experience for their fans. Known for performing a diverse mix of The Floyd’s extensive 16-album repertoire (complete with faithful renditions of popular hits as well as obscure gems), The Machine’s stellar musicianship, dramatic lighting and video, and their passionate delivery sets them above and beyond the rest.

In the classic tradition, The Machine explores collective improvisation paralleling and even rivaling that of an early 1970’s Pink Floyd mentality. Their use of expanded theatrical elements and elaborate stage displays continues in the spirit of the later Floyd lineups of the 1980’s. The band is also known for recreating entire albums as a part of their show, accepting requests from fans, and for taking an A to Z approach in which one song is played for every letter of the alphabet. Additionally, the quartet has been sharing the stage with full symphony orchestras, including the Atlanta, Detroit, Pittsburgh and San Diego Symphonies.

https://www.bergenpac.org/events/detail/the-machine-performing-pink-floyd
results.name: The Machine performs Pink Floyd!!!

results.description:
ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:  www.tennis-buffs.com

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time. I would like to stagger players. You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left. Thank you for your understanding.

Saturdays, starts 8pm

Cost $40

Includes tennis, balls and food

9 Indoor air-conditioned hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends! Binghamton Racquet Club is centrally located for tennis players in the Tri-State area, only 5 minutes from the GWB, a good location for players from Rockland County, NYC, Westchester, Hoboken, Jersey City and other areas in NJ.

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com

Join us for a night of inspiring music that spans genres and a contagiously high energy vibe to keep your body moving in a friendly, exciting, drug-and-alcohol-free, judgement-free zone. We hope you'll join us!

New York Insight Meditation Center
28 West 27th St., 10th Floor (Buzzer #27)
NYC

***SCHEDULE***
7:30-8:00 Setup
8:00-8:30 Warmup
8:30 Freestyle dancing
10:00-10:15 Community announcement circle
10:15-11:30 Freestyle dancing continues

***WE NEED VOLUNTEERS***
Pitch in to run the dance! Help with set-up, do a door shift, or help with take-down, and get $5 off admission - do two of the above and get in free. 

Suggested donation for entry - $10-15.

***EASY TO GET TO***
Nearby trains: 1, 6, F, M, R, N
Map & Directions:

***FOR THOSE COMING IN BY CAR***
There's on-street parking for those coming in from out of town. Just a short ride in from the Lincoln Tunnel. 

Spread the word!

results.description:
You just got a bill from your Dr that isn't covered by insurance, Con-Ed somehow didn't get your payment last month, Bank of America is tacking on transaction fees when no transactions were made. Don't just sit there and take it.. There are 6 words that get results!

LET ME SPEAK TO YOUR MANAGER!!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room.

Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

Seating is limited and by reservation only.  To Reserve a seat, RSVP through Eventbrite w. your best email and show your confirmation at the door. 

Eventbrite Link: http://bit.ly/1RlxzUx

Seating in the backroom starts at 9 and the show starts shortly after. 
Come early and hang out in the front room of the bar!

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum.

Come out and celebrate the weekend with some laughs!
results.name: Let Me Speak To Your Manager! - FREE COMEDY SHOW
