results.description: Though March comes in like a lion and out like a lamb doesn't mean we should be so docile! Join me for a good old fashioned bar crawl through the East Village! We will go a little late into the night, heading from north to south, hitting at least four bars, each with a different scene/vibe. This will be a great opportunity to explore new places to go out, meet new people, and take advantage of what this city has to offer. Bring an open mind, maybe a friend, and prepare for a late night with some libation!
results.name: East Village Bar Crawl

Hi Everyone,

Join us for fun and competition... RSVP NOW!</a> Limited spots available.

We are going INDOORS in Brooklyn for SATURDAY NIGHTS

9:00 PM- 10:00 PM (1 hour Group Drill for BEGINNER/INTERMEDIATE) COST $25 p.p.; 10:00 PM - 11:00 PM (followed by 1 hour match play) $15:  Total Cost $40

(HIGH INTERMEDIATE/ADVANCED) Cost:  $30 p.p. includes two hours of indoor tennis with same level players, balls, water & light food.

(BEGinner, INTermediate, ADVanced players are grouped in their designated categories)

Please note there is very limited space available...   

MUST <a href="http://www.meetup.com/nystennismb/events/229758200/">RSVP NOW</a> and specify Group drill & match play OR Match Play Only.

PLEASE ARRIVE AT 8:45 PM.

Please note that NY Social Tennis is here to provide fun & competition, please feel free to contact us with your thoughts, concerns, or preference. 

What to Expect... (Warm-up, hitting/drill before placement into levels to play; please feel free to specify if you have a preference... (singles, doubles, mixed).  We will do our best to accommodate!

Look forward to meeting and playing tennis... LET'S HAVE SOME FUN & COMPETITION!

Thanks,

Lily :)

results.description:
Please read ALL details BEFORE you RSVP. Third party ticket purchase REQUIRED. 

You know Cho! If you need to be reminded, see clips of her by clicking here. If you don't know Margaret Cho, learn more about her here.

Let's check her out LIVE on her new comedy tour! Tickets are $35 per person plus a 2 item minimum. Not a bad deal for a headliner like Cho at a local venue without having to travel to a huge theater in the city. 

YOU MUST CLICK HERE TO PURCHASE YOUR TICKET(S). To sit with the group: enter Get out and Do Something Meetup when the registration form asks "Are you coming with another party?"


PLEASE DO NOT RSVP UNTIL YOU HAVE PURCHASED YOUR TICKET(S). Please confirm with me that you DID buy tickets when you RSVP so I can make sure they seat us together. 

As always, if you cannot make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time.
results.name: Margaret Cho- The Woman! The Comic! The Legend!

results.description:
Playmusician Presents:

Jersey City Bollywood Bhangra Dance Party with DJ Rekha and DJ DJ ZEEMUFFIN 

HOT UPDATE !! DJ ZEEMUFFIN will be Opening on Saturday for DJ REKHA at Playmusician's JC/DESI event at Transmission.

We are all super excited to have her onboard . Grab your tickets now ! 
http://playmusician.eventbrite.com

Sat March 26 / 9:30pm Onwards

Drink Specials all nite.

Venue:

THe DJ / Dance Club Room @ Transmission is a state -of-the-art DJ / Dance Club. It has a capacity of 250 people and has some of the best DJs from NYC & NJ taking stage. 

About DJ REKHA

DJ Rekha is a producer, curator and educator based in New York City. She is the founder of the Basement Bhangra™, Bollywood Disco and co-founder of Mutiny Club nights. She was named "Ambassador of Bhangra" by the New York Times. Rekha was the sound designer for the TONY award-winning Broadway Show, "Bridge and Tunnel", received a Drama Desk Award nomination for her work on the play "Rafta Rafta"and the associate producer for the NPR Radio Documentary, "A Feet in Two Worlds." Her debut album, DJ Rekha presents Basement Bhangra was released in 2007. In 2009, DJ Rekha was inducted into the New York City's Peoples’ Hall of Fame. Her record label Beat Bazaar Music issued its debut single release, Pyar Baile worldwide in Nov. 2011. She has curated events for Celebrate Brooklyn, Central Park Summerstage and has performed internationally. DJ Rekha was a Grand Marshall of the 9th Annual NYC Dance Parade in 2015. You can see her perform live the first Thursdays at Le Poisson Rouge in New York City and hear her weekly podcast Bhangra and Beyond on  www.breakthruradio.com

We encourage you to purchase your Early Bird $10 tickets online now :  playmusician.eventbrite.com

At Door $15

Venue:  Transmission, 150 Bay Street, Jersey City . NJ 07302

RSVP & More info here:  

https://www.facebook.com/events/993061657406337/

PLAYMUSICIAN are quality curators for live music events in the Tri-State area sice 2011.

Arts . Community . Events

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE


We’ve got another big night going down at the Covered VIP Rooftop at Stage 48! Rain or shine, this amazing venue, will give you an incredible scenic view of the city. Our Stage 48 party series is known to get wild, with people dancing harder than anything we’ve ever seen, so we’re really excited to see what this wonderful night on the rooftop will bring.

There Will Be 3 Dj’s Spinning Live!
Green DJ: Top 40 Dance Hits
Red DJ: 80’s/90’s/EDM Mashups
Blue DJ: Hip Hop/R&B/Reggae

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
Covered and heated VIP Rooftop
Rooftop View Of The City
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
Tickets are limited, so act fast!
This party is going on rain or shine.
Age Restriction: 21+

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: VIP Covered Rooftop @ Stage 48!

Few Pics From Our Nov 28th Event : http://on.fb.me/1ItEDAo
Few Pics From Our Nov 21st Event : http://on.fb.me/1LSyuIY
Few Pics From Our Nov 14th Event : http://on.fb.me/1XNCkdh
Few Pics From Our Nov 7th Event : http://on.fb.me/1QkcVHo

DESI SATURDAYS

Presents

BOLLYWOOD BEATS

At New York City’s Mega Nightclub & Lounge
L E X I C O N
226 East 54th Street. NYC 

Special Guest : Featuring Delhi's Finest Dj Amit
Lexicon Resident : Dj Harsh
Dhol Percussions By : RAVI BINDRA

Dress Code: Fashion Forward & Chic
Strictly No T-shirts, No Boots, No sneakers. 
21 & Over - Proper ID Required For Admission

For RSVP : www.DesiSaturdays.com
For VIP Table Reservations : 908 - 425 - 1603

Desi Saturdays is one high society DesiParty. Wow factor everywhere. Beautiful people, beautiful venue, beautiful ambiance, and did we mention beautiful people? High energy, amazing music and a packed house are just some of the traits of what you would expect at this weekly desiparty.

This event is the talk of the town amongst young socialites. It's so exclusive it only takes place on Saturday Nights, and don't even try to dress down, because it is almost impossible to get in, but more importantly you would feel so out of place. So don your best, and you may just be lucky enough to party out on Saturdays Nights at Lexicon!!

group.name: Bollywood, Bhangra, Desi Party & Events. DesiSaturdays.com

results.description:
This is a repost from a Facebook Event Page, please join the fb page to stay updated on this event: https://www.facebook.com/events/814098778718361/

Join us on bicycles or skates at 10pm on the last Saturday of every month at the Columbus Circle (59th Street) entrance to Central Park for a totally safe, magical, evening ride in Manhattan. From Columbus Circle, we head west and then noodle our way north, exploring Riverside Park's bicycle-friendly pedpaths. Nearing the northernmost point on our ride, we pass Riverside Church and Grant's Tomb. (Who's buried there?) Southbound, we ride the Hudson River Greenway enjoying grand vistas of the Hudson River. Many folks head home on the Greenway, but for those who want to return to our starting point, it's a pleasant ride on city streets back to Columbus Circle where the ride ends between midnight and 12:30am.

This ride covers 8-10 miles and lasts about 2 hours. Weather? We only cancel when no one in their right mind would have fun. Dress for the weather. We hope these rides encourage folks to enjoy our parks at night: quiet, safe, and relaxed.
results.name: Riverside Ride - March 2016

results.description:
In 400 years of Shakespeare, there’s never been a night of Bard on the boards quite like "Gary Busey’s One-Man Hamlet as Performed by David Carl." The 2015 Edinburgh Fringe hit hailed by critics as “pant-soilingly hysterical” (British Theatre Guide) comes to NYC’s PIT Loft for a two-month run, March 26-May 14, before heading to the Chicago Shakespeare Theater as part of their year-long Shakespeare 400 celebration.

As Shakespearean actor, puppeteer, singer and action-movie director, Gary Busey (played by New York actor-writer David Carl) performs each scene of Hamlet his way, with occasional detours into great Busey moments from "Buddy Holly" and "Lethal Weapon." The heady mix of high and low-brow comedy celebrates Shakespeare’s classic by using it to reflect upon the jaded, celebrity-crazed, meme-obsessed world around us.

★★★★ “Crazy hilarious.” - TimeOut New York
“So demented a concept, it actually works” – NY Post
★★★★★ “70 batshit crazy hilarious minutes” - Broadway Baby

The smash hit of the New York and Edinburgh Fringe Festivals, "Gary Busey’s One-Man Hamlet..." won the Outstanding Solo Performance Award at the New York Fringe in 2014, and received 5-star reviews at the 2015 Edinburgh Festival Fringe. The show will begin extensive North America touring in 2016, including performances at the Chicago Shakespeare Theater - proving that "Where there's a Bard, there's a Busey!"

Written by David Carl (after Shakespeare) and co-created and directed by Michole Biancosino.
results.name: Gary Busey's One-Man Hamlet as Performed by David Carl Returns to NYC

results.description:
Every year we continue the celebration of the Easter Vigil with friends old and new at a local bar/restaurant.  Please join us following the Vigil at Good Enough to Eat located on Columbus Avenue and 85th street.  You can meet us on the sidewalk in front of the church or meet us at the restaurant.

If you have never been out before this is a wonderful night to meet and interact with CRC members old and new!

We will arrange to have appetizers and snacks for the group and you will be responsible to pay for your own drinks.  We ask for a $10 donation per person for the food.


If you have any questions contact Dave Cervini at[masked] or [masked].

Can I come alone? Yes most of those attending will be coming on their own.  Your event host will make sure to introduce you to others in the group.

How should I dress: Whatever you would wear to mass (leave the Easter Bonnet home)

What is the age range? 20's - 40's mostly with a sprinkle of 50's :)

How long does it last?  The group will likely stay until 1am but you can head out anytime.

results.description:
This is a sunrise bird walk where we will approximately cover 2 miles of gentle walking from the parking lot, through the woods along the shore, and back.  We celebrate at sunrise to lift up the coming spring and rebirth of abundant life around us.  We just missed the equinox and the storm moon with this event, but it is Easter morning in the Christian calendar, and so we rise early to greet life and be nurtured by it.

We will be gathering at the entrance to the Wildlife Sanctuary where there is a gate.   We begin with opening words and people introducing themselves. Then we will walk around this park that has woods, marsh, open water, and plenty of paths.  As we go, we will pause for reflection, nature spiritual practices, and to learn about and identify birds.  

If the sky is clear, come early at 6:15 a.m. and we can see what late dawn stars we can see.

Please do RSVP so I can let you know of any changes due to weather.   Led by Rev. LoraKim Joyner.  

Bring binoculars (I will have spares) and comfortable walking shoes, and dress warmly.

If you get lost, you can contact me on my mobile:  [masked]-9574.
results.how_to_find_us: The entrance to the park is inside Playland in Rye (1 Playland Drive). Enter Playland and go right to the end of the parking lot. We will gather outside the entrance to the park, which is a yellow bar gate.
results.name: Sunrise Bird Walk: Nurturing Ourselves to Nurture Nature

group.name: The Conservationist's Way: A Nurture Nature Group

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8, no subs. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you turn up late and the game has already started with 16 players, then you won't play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
Book to discuss: A Brief History of Time   by Stephen Hawking

Below is from Amazon.com

"#1 NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER

A landmark volume in science writing by one of the great minds of our time, Stephen Hawking’s book explores such profound questions as: How did the universe begin—and what made its start possible? Does time always flow forward? Is the universe unending—or are there boundaries? Are there other dimensions in space? What will happen when it all ends?

Told in language we all can understand, A Brief History of Time plunges into the exotic realms of black holes and quarks, of antimatter and “arrows of time,” of the big bang and a bigger God—where the possibilities are wondrous and unexpected. With exciting images and profound imagination, Stephen Hawking brings us closer to the ultimate secrets at the very heart of creation."

Available in New York Public Library (including E-book and audible).
results.name: Club Meeting 7

results.description:
Come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.


Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the meetup.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.
results.how_to_find_us: Be sure to check the site for those who have signed up. We're usually easy to spot.

results.description:
Note: This event is starting at 8:30 am, NOT as 10:00 am as it said in the original announcement.


Time for another Palisades trail run! This run will start at the bus station, go over the bridge, up the Palisades Long Path and back.

I’ll be running at a 9-11 minute/mile pace and aiming for the Park Headquarters (19 miles round-trip from the bus station). Every pace and distance is welcome, but be prepared to run on your own if you can't find someone who matches yours. Other notable turn-around points include the State Line Cafe (25 miles round-trip), Alpine Lookout (16 miles round-trip), Greenbrook Sanctuary (13 miles round-trip), and the Rockefeller Lookout (10 miles round-trip).


Note that if you turn around before the Park Headquarters, you might be looking at up to 13 miles between water sources. Please make sure you plan your hydration accordingly!


If you would like to meet up with us on the New Jersey side, find us at the trail start just over the pedestrian bridge just before 9:00 am. Please indicate this in your RSVP. 

Here’s a map of the trail. The Long Path is marked “A” on the map and is marked with aqua blazes. Please familiarize yourself with the trail map before coming to the run.

Here's a list of landmarks along with their distance from the start on the NJ side.


I’ve also made a Google Map that shows the trail along with several points of interest, including restrooms and places to get water. This map is approximate - do not rely on it for navigation!

As always, please view the group's About page and make sure you understand your responsibilities as an event participant.
results.how_to_find_us: The George Washington Bridge Bus Terminal is closed for construction. We will meet at the trailer on Ft. Washington Ave. that is serving as the temporary bus station.
results.name: Easter Palisades Long Path Trail Run

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

DESCRIPTION:


Whether you want to play competitively, hit around, or even just check out the hot guys and girls, you've come to the right place. I will try to host the badminton events on bi-weekly basis in order to provide you with an badminton experience where you can get your daily exercise in, improve at the game of badminton, and socialize with other fellow badminton-ers, all at the same time!

After the badminton event, we will have lunch together at Flushing.


To have a good play experience, we will put a cap of  8 on the attendee.
Please only RSVP when you are sure you will show up.

WEAR:
Sport cloth and sneaker.

BRING:
Badminton racquets and birdies, bottles of water, towel and clothes to change.
PS.If you don't have a badminton racquet, you can rent one at the center for $4 per day and $20 deposit.

LOCATION:
New York Badminton Center,[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 ( enter 34th Ave from College Point Blvd )
New York Badminton Center (NYBC) is designated badminton facility with 6 international tournament standard Badminton floor mats on top of 3″ high wood floor elevation for maximum shock absorbing and pressure reduction to knees and ankles.  Center also equipped with Table Tennis, Weights room, kids room, and spacious resting area, large bathrooms. Center opens 7 days all year around. It offers the convenience for players to play on any of the days they prefer. Center is close to public transportation (about 10 mins walking), street parking is also available.   

For more info about NY Badminton Center, check the link in the reference section below. 


TRANSPORTATION:
Subway: #7 train to Main St. Station, 10-13 min walk.



REFERENCE LINK:

• http://newyorkbadmintoncenter.com/

http://www.meetup.com/NYCAsianMeetup/pages/Disclaimer

venue.name: Mohonk Preserve Visitor Center

results.description:
Enjoy a hike/rock scramble while taking in some magnificent views of the preserve. Highlights: Insane views, cool stroll around Mohonk Mountain House and property, crazy rock labyrinth, claustrophobia-defying climb up a deep crevice, Sky Top Tower.

Distance: 8 - 10 miles, loop

Approximate round trip time: 6- 7 hours (Depending on your pace) we start walking at 10:30am

Total ascent: 973 ft

Max Elevation: 1,617 ft above sea level

Entrance fee: $12.00 per person. Groups of 30 or more must register for permit prior to date.

Pooch proclivity: No doggies allowed

Descriptions: Up the steep stone stairs to stay on the carriage roads to Mohonk Mountain House. Rock scramble at the Labyrinth and up the lemon squeeze to the top. Lunch and then up the tower house for the 360 view of Mohonk Preserves.

Required Gear:

Hiking boots

change of socks

Sunscreen

Windbreaker

Hat

Climbing gloves (Home Depot and Walmart has cheap gardening gloves with good grip)

2.5 liters of Water

Lunch and snacks

Head lamps

Cash $

And don’t forget your camera :) !

Driving Directions: New Paltz Exit 18 off of the NYS Thruway. 7 miles west (through New Paltz) on Route 299 to the end. Right on Route 44-55. The Preserve Visitor Center will be 1/2 mile on the right.

*** THIS EVENT WILL BE CANCELLED IF IT’S 30 - 50% CHANCE OF RAIN. RESCHEDULE DATE IS SUNDAY ***

Remember it's up to you to take the initiative to find your own rides. Post a comment below if you're a passenger that needs a ride (splits gas/tolls) or a DRIVER that can pick people up. If you don't get a response, you can contact the driver via their profile page or if they have a post stating that their offering a ride. If still that leads to nowhere, rent a car is an option or contacts me VIA TEXT ONLY PLEASE.

Participation in activities is strictly voluntary and group members assume all risks in connection with activities; per Meetup.com's Terms of Service Agreements, organizers and hike/trip leaders are released from any and all forms of liability related to events.

This hike is for you if: You want to see some of the coolest sights in the Hudson Valley and you’re not afraid to crawl under (and around, and through, and over) some rocks to see ‘em.

Text me at for any questions [masked]-2397.
results.name: Mohonk Rock Scramble Hike:Labyrinth-Lemon Squeeze (8-10 Miles)

results.description:
Hi there! I started this group last year, and I want to keep it going, as sharing meditation with others is my passion. We'll meet Saturdays and Sundays at 10am under the big shady tree at the Great Hill in Central park (the entrance is Central Park west and 103rd street). Take the path leading into central park, and go left (up the slope) until you get to the clearing at the top of the hill. If it's rainy or bad weather, I won't be there, but if the suns out, you can find me under the hill. I will let the group know ahead of time if I have to cancel in advance. The session starts 10am, running till around 10:45 or 11am. Bring a towel to sit on, and some water to drink. Beginners and experienced meditators welcome. I try to incorporate a range of styles, as different methods suit different people. I practice vipassana (the practice of calm abiding and observing) and qigong (the art of moving the body's energy), which mold quite well together. Look forward to seeing all of you!

This meditation is free. A $5-10 donation is suggested, but not at all necessary.
results.how_to_find_us: At Central Park West and 103rd Street, take the path into Central Park.  Immiditately after entering, turn left and take the stairs up the path leading upwards.  After reaching the clearing at the top of the hill, find us under the big shady tree
results.name: Meditate

results.description:
Hi! I'm Aishling, a recently certified PiYo instructor. PiYo is a fun and dynamic blend of Pilates and Yoga. It combines the muscle-sculpting, core-firming benefits of Pilates with the strength and flexibility advantages of yoga. And, I crank up the speed to deliver a true fat-burning, low-impact workout that leaves your body looking long, lean, and incredibly defined.

I teach classes at On Your Toes Dance Studio on McLean Ave in Yonkers every Sunday morning at 10am and I would love to have you join me. Classes are usually $10 pay as you go but I am offering your first class for free! Feel free to bring a friend too. Don't worry if you can't make it this week. I am there every Sunday! Feel free to reach out to me at [masked] or call/text me on (914)[masked] if you have any questions or if you want to chat.

Hope to see you there!
Aishling

results.description:
Uncover the power of a quieter mind and ensure the renewal of a healthier you through movement, breath, and meditation. I welcome each student to come escape the bustle of the city to experience above and find their inner guru in my  class!

WELCOME SPRING! 

IT IS SPRING!  YES?!  Come nourish and watch your new year seedling/wish grow with yummy energizing practice each week! While the air is warming and the earth is becoming fertile with rain, it's a perfect opportunity to stretch out and try out new patterns, create, and manifest 2016! What will it be like?  


Since March 2013, this donation based Meet Up group has aimed to provide a light-hearted and non-competitive space.  One can expect clear instructions, demonstration, gentle hands-on assistance, and achieve greater flexibility, strength, balance, focus, and sense of ease with regular attendance.  

Extra mats and blocks are limited, kindly bring yours if you have them.


*To offset Meetup Organizer's fees, a suggested donation of $10+ will be greatly appreciated*

Thank you and please do post any questions.  I hope to see you soon! 

Jennifer ( 500 Hour Yoga Alliance Registered  Teacher)

results.description:
Easter Parade Sunday, March 27, 2015, 11 AM


Sorry for the short notice but we can't miss the "Easter Parade."  It brings Spring and renewal to the year and hopefully puts the nasty winter weather behind us. Grab your bonnet and your camera and join us as we stroll along Fifth Avenue in the annual Easter Parade. This New York City tradition kicks off around 47th Street and extends north to 54th Street with the main "paraders" in front of St. Patrick’s Cathedral. The "parade" begins around 10 AM but don't worry about coming late.  The strollers welcome you to shoot them in their Easter finery. From past shoots, the "parade" lasts until 1 PM and then slowly peters out.  Wear your Sunday best!  And your camera's built-in flash or an accessory strobe will be useful.  

No formal time to arrive, just jump in and shoot.  Take the ""B, D, F or M" trains to 47-50th Street stop on the 6th Avenue Line and walk over to Fifth Avenue or the #7 to Fifth Avenue.  You can also walk down from the "E or M" train from the 5th Ave/53rd Street stop.  Check the train schedules as there's always maintenance work on the weekends  See you there!

RSVP at right.  No charge for this event!  

We can meet up after the shoot around 1 PM at 47th Street and Fifth Avenue (NE corner)  and grab a bite to eat (Optional and Dutch treat!).
results.how_to_find_us: Photographers Shooting In and Around the "Easter Parade!"
results.name: FIELD TRIP: FIFTH AVENUE EASTER PARADE SUNDAY MARCH 27, 2015, 11 AM!

results.description:
It's time to get kicking. Kick your neighbor. Kick your brother. Kick the big red ball. Just don't kick your dog. Game. On.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of kickball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game with rules similar to baseball -- except instead of using a bat to hit a little ball, you use your feet to kick a ball about 10x the size of a baseball. Kick the ball, run to the base, avoid getting your ball caught mid-air or yourself tagged out. Easy. And no athletic skill is necessary, just the ability to kick! Go out and practice now to get ready. Kick the postman when he delivers your bills. Kick that neighbor who won't turn down his stereo. Just get kicking!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/64476072/Kickball%20Rules.pdf.</a>

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be kicking and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.

results.description:
Topic: Resilient Families and Communities

Description: “The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.” ― Nelson Mandela

Our March theme is resilience: in what way are we, at the Society for Ethical Culture, people of resilience? How do we not only survive pain, illness and adversity, but recover and “bounce back”? Our tendency in the world today is to think of resilience as an individual task — this week, we’ll explore how resilience relates to the web of connections that surround us, and, most importantly, address some of the concrete ways we can make our families and communities — and especially the children within them — more resilient.

Our tendency in the world today is to think of resilience as an individual task — this week, we’ll explore how resilience relates to the web of connections that surround us, and how community contributes to individual resilience even as individuals contribute to community resilience.

Speaker: Jone Johnson Lewis is the clergy Leader of the Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture. Jone has been an Ethical Culture Leader since 1991, serving Ethical Societies in Chicago, Northern Virginia and Brooklyn. She's currently the President of the National Council of Leaders and a member of the American Ethical Union's Membership Committee. 

For more information: http://www.rysec.org/event/people-resilience-2016

results.description:
Updated March 5, 2016

WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 

[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

results.name: Sunday Ultimate @ 12PM, Riverside Park

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.

WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...

1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated

9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved

Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Are you looking for a complementary training to ENHANCE your overall well being on and off the track, to be more FLEXIBLE and RELEASE physical, mental and emotional tensions?


Are you looking for RELIEF from joint wear, tightness, pain, and/or discomfort?

$5 FOR FIRST CLASS TO CROSS TRAIN...

_________________________________________________

About Yin Yang Yoga...A typical Yoga class is ‘Yang’ in style and focuses on active heating and muscular contraction - by starting with ‘Yin’, a more passive, nourishing, and cooling practice, this uniquely designed class WILL enhance your alignment, performance, and overall sense of balance!


Why For Runners/Athletes? - Lengthening and releasing effect from repetitive movements on sheets of connective tissue can overtime shorten and tighten it in ingrained patterns around the muscles. This fascia restriction can make one more prone to having injuries, abnormal posture, and inefficiency, as well as asymmetrical weakening. By targeting rotated key areas in weekly Yin Yang Yoga For Runners class, one can experience tension release, fluid movement, and benefit from improved posture, circulation, injury prevention, as well as increased respiratory control and mental focus...

Each Yin Yang Yoga for Runners class begins with a series of held Yin/floor postures. While surrendering into the edge of each pose (for 2-5 minutes), students are guided to experience the discomforting stagnant energy and its release around the hips, thighs, and lower back, and be connected to the present moment. The Yang flow sequence designed to follow will allow students to integrate the newly released energy, joint spaces for greater circulation and achieve new level of flexibility and energy.  Guided Relaxation provided at the end will promise to be YUMMY!

__________________________________________________

Testimonies x3: "Jennifer is an awesome instructor. Her sessions are informative and her teaching style is patient, clear and inspires me to attain increased fitness. I look forward to attending her class. The very next day I was able to push through my usual 3-4 miles to complete a 6 mile run." Sandra

"I ran my best time running a 18 mile course the day after..." Lori

“ I started taking Jennifer's Yin/Yang Yoga for Runner's Class over the summer, and it was fantastic. I had never practiced yoga regularly before, and was pleasantly surprised at how it helped to improve my flexibility, running, and overall fitness. Jennifer is a great, hands-on teacher, and really knows how the body works. I highly recommend this class! ” Theresa

________________________________________________________

THIS PERFORMANCE ENHANCING WEEKLY 1.25 HOUR CLASS IS NOT OFFERED ANYWHERE ELSE IN NYC! COME CHECK IT OUT!

By Cash or Check

Did I Already Mention----FIRST CLASS FOR ONLY $ 5!!

Bring a Friend Get a Free Future Class Pass!

Please dress in layers (cool to start) and it's okay to eat prior.  Please message any questions and pass this invite to your friends. Thank you and see ya you on the mat!


Namaste, Jennifer, RYT-500hr

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: $24 Day­pass during the meetup. For monthly/yearly membership, the Initiation Fee (currently $99) is waived (no discount on monthly dues, for yearly membership please inquire with the Cliffs for discount). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is FREE for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101/Top-rope basic class is offered 50% Off. Must sign­up and pay in advance by calling the Cliffs at 718­729­76125.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)

results.description:
Transmission Meditation with Meryl Tihanyi Alternate Sundays Beginning March 1st
1:00-3:00pm
Free Do you want to help the world and also build a stronger connection with your own spiritual nature? Transmission Meditation is a simple group meditation that provides both a dynamic service to the world and the opportunity for powerful personal spiritual development. *It is a group meditation based on the Science of Triangles, that makes possible the scientific distribution or transmission of highly potent spiritual energies into the world.
*It is the creation, in conscious co-operation with the Masters of Wisdom, of a vortex or pool of higher energy for the benefit of humanity.
*It is a combination of two yogas: Karma yoga (the yoga of service) and Laya yoga (the yoga of energy or chakras).
*Introduced to the world in 1974 by artist and author Benjamin Creme, there are now hundreds of Transmission Meditation groups active in many countries around the world.
*It is safe, and will enhance and complement any other spiritual practice or service activity in which you may already be engaged. Come to a FREE introduction to Transmission Meditation, followed by a group meditation.
results.name: Transmission Meditation with Meryl Tihanyi

venue.name: Grace Baptist Church of Forest Hills

results.description:
Event Host:  Grace Baptist Church of Forest Hills, Pastor Tim and Pastor Andrew.

"'For as by a man came death, by a man has come also the resurrection of the dead.  For as in Adam all die, so also in Christ shall all be made alive' (1 Corinthians 15:21-22).

Growing up. Easter meant many things to me.  I knew that I'd get a new shirt from my mom, and perhaps chocolate goodies and coins scattered across our lawn through an Easter Egg hunt.  Those traditions are fond memories, and we'll host a little Easter egg hunt for young ones on the lawn this Easter Sunday too.  But as I grew older I embraced the revolutionary message of Easter and how God's resurrection changed my life entirely forever.  Please come Sunday, March 27th and hear God's message of how this truth impacts you today.  All services are free, and are open to the public.  We invite you to stay for the Easter Egg hunt (age 3-10) and fellowship meal following the service.

*Friday, March 25th 7:00 pm-- Good Friday Service

*Sunday, March 27th 1:00 pm--Resurrection Sunday Celebration"


Pastor Tim Richmond and Pastor Andrew Snavely

www.graceofforesthills.com

www.twitter.com/timrichmondnyc

www.guineafield.blogspot.com

<a>[masked]</a>
results.name: Resurrection Sunday Celebration at Grace Baptist Church of Forest Hills

results.description:
For Spectators

-----------------
Parade starts promptly at 1:00 pm by exiting Field 9E at Tenth Street.
The cars will travel south on Franklin Avenue to Seventh Street.  West to Hilton Avenue, where the parade will terminate. Date/Time Information: Easter Sunday, March 27 from 10 am to 3 pm.

For Cars

----------

Cars will start assembling at 10:00 am, Parking Field 9E, east side of Franklin Avenue between Ninth and Eleventh Street.  Enter only at Ninth Street.

61st Easter Car Parade to be gala event

One of the "golden oldies" at last year's Parade. Plans are in motion for the 61st anniversary of the Garden City Chamber of Commerce's Easter Sunday Vintage Car Parade to be held April 5. The parade will step off on Franklin Avenue at Tenth Street with antique, classic, and special interest cars throughout the metropolitan area expected to participate in the lineup.

Spectators are welcome to preview the hundreds of magnificent vintage car specimens at the staging area in Parking Field 9E on Franklin Avenue between Ninth and Tenth Streets from10 a.m. to 1 p.m. when the parade steps off. The procession of cars will head south on Franklin and west on Seventh Street to Hilton Avenue where it will disperse.

The renowned Banjo Rascals will wander among the crowds with their tow-tappin' tunes at the car exhibit. During the parade, they will re-appear on Seventh Street along with the wandering Easter Bunnies bearing lollipops for the kids (courtesy of the Kiwanis Club of Garden City for some 40 years).
results.name: 61st Annual Easter Vintage Car Parade

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game for all levels. 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe, Please bring  $4 in cash to the game. 

RSVP closes at 11:15AM (2 hours before the game)

PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP by midnight the day before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Williamsburg Soccer Training activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Williamsburg Soccer Training Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Williamsburg Soccer Training programs or activities.

results.description:
Easter egg hunts have been a childhood springtime tradition for many but we're bringing the game back to ADULTS, in the most epic way possible: a NYC-wide Scavenger Egg Hunt!

We're once again partnering with Pogo Events for this annual Easter Egg Hunt! A series of clues will lead you around NYC looking for hidden eggs worth points and prizes! 

GET TIX HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Mar-27-2016_at_0130PM

What to expect: 

• A fun day with with new friends 

• Discover hidden parts of the city

• Mental and (not-so) physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

You can come alone and be placed with a team or you can sign up with friends. 

*BUY TICKETS HERE ($25, price goes up as date gets closer) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Mar-27-2016_at_0130PM

*Prepay Only Event (No tickets sold at door)

Who can attend? All are welcome. This is not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 

What should I wear? Dress for the elements. Be prepared for to walk. Dress comfortable – Most teams wear running shoes. 

What should I bring? A fun attitude, A Smart Phone if you have (either Android or I-Phone - fully charged) The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. Please download that before you come to the event.

What if it rains? You won’t melt, we promise! The race still goes on. Races can actually be MORE fun in the rain! 

Why does your RSVP say +25? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have at least 25 members attend.  

Where do I get a ticket? You must prepay to attend. Tickets will not be sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out so get your tickets ASAP.

PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Mar-27-2016_at_0130PM
results.name: The Amazing Easter Egg Hunt for ADULTS! (PREPAY ONLY)

results.description:
One of our members had a great idea to do a French Toast themed event, so we are making a brunch out of it. 

For this meetup you are required to make one unique french toast recipe. Standard french toast is not allowed. I have included some links to some interesting french toast recipes to help give you some ideas. feel free to use any of these or come up with one of your own. 

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2015/02/25/french-toast-recipe_n_1891605.html


http://www.buzzfeed.com/tashweenali/french-toast-recipes


This is a group cooking event so we will be cooking together. Please bring your ingredients prepped and ready to go. 

If you wish to drink with us please contribute a wine or cocktail. 

I have a small 7lb hypo allergenic Yorkie Poo named Pepper, he is really sweet and loves people, but if you have an issue with dogs please refrain from RSVPing to this event.

The fine print: 

Please pick out what you would like to cook and confirm that you can make this event on March 27th  Each cook may bring one non-cook to enjoy the meal!

Cancellations: Please be 100% committed to attending this event, and cancel 48 hours in advance. There is limited space and each member puts in a lot of time, effort, and planning into each of these events. Late cancellations affect the group as a whole. If you cancel with less than 48 hours notice, or are a no show you could be removed from the group.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
results.name: Soccer Sunday -@west 102nd Street Field - 1:45pm

results.description:
The Stilt-Sands are destroyed, and a terrible leviathan has awoken to plague the Ten Isles once more. All that remains of hundreds of sails and thousands of sailors are two ships and three hundred souls. Precipice Port is a fortnight away, the only destination for hundreds of miles of ocean, and you must reach it. Not all is as it seems amongst the sailors and refugees, however. Someone or something has slipped aboard, and its intentions are surely murderous. Can you reveal the hidden evil before it is too late?

Fortnight of Fear is the fourth chapter for the WildPig Exclusive Campaign "Sailing Against the Wind" by Noah Anderson. New and returning players are welcome. Characters are 7th level, with a limit of 8 players per session. There will be time for character creation a half-hour before the first session. Seats are limited, so please register ahead of time.

results.description:
This ride combines some of the fun from the traffic and climbing rides- get ready! Let's meet at Grand Army Plaza by the arch and do a lap around Prospect Park. We'll close the loop and exit to continue north on the Vanderbuilt Ave bike path to snake our way around the naval yard and on towards Greenpoint along the Kent Ave path. We'll push over the Pulaski and through Astoria to climb the Queensboro bridge to arrive at 1st Ave in Manhattan. From there we'll dart west on 60th st to arrive at Central Park at the southeast entrance and pick up the bike path within. We'll do an almost complete loop to exit at Columbus Circle and pick up the Broadway bike path, charging south back towards Brooklyn and finish back at the Grand Army Plaza arch.


We'll pace it to the group but this one should be a really fun mix of climbs, protected stretches, and charging through traffic. Hope to see you there!

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 2:00. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 2:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

The Hope Hill community invites you to join us next Sunday, March 27th to celebrate Resurrection (Easter) Sunday! Mark you calendars to celebrate this meaningful holiday at Hope Hill's Easter Sunday Service at 3:00pm.

Hope Hill is an authentic and exciting church that meets weekly at 236 W. 72nd St. in Manhattan. Our Sunday services gather an amazing crowd for food, music, networking, a thought-provoking lecture, and life-changing discussion. We welcome everyone to join us for the Sunday service at 3:00pm and to come early at 2:30pm or stay late to network and connect with the Hope Hill Community.

If you are looking to deepen your faith or wrestle with questions on spirituality, this is your place. Join in the refreshments, live music, intelligent Bible study, and discussion — and connect with amazing New Yorkers just like you.

results.description:
No preparation needed for this meeting! Just bring up to 1,500 words of writing—a flash piece or an excerpt from a longer piece you are working on or the outline of an idea that you need help with. People are encouraged to bring work generated through Writing Room exercises.

The format works like this:

Each writer gets a total of up to 30 minutes, which begins when they read their piece aloud or give a pitch of their idea in five minutes or less. We will be able to do 4 or 5 pieces/ideas per meeting. Names will be drawn at random. (Anyone whose work is not chosen will get priority at the next meeting.) You don’t need to bring work to attend and no advance preparation is required.

Please feel free to bring drinks or snacks. Arielle has power strips to plug in and space to write at both a table and on couches and chairs. Also, there are two cats, in case anyone has allergies.

See you there!

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught this Sunday from 4-6pm

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
All you love is gone. The Stilt-Sands, a floating city you have called home since birth, was torn to pieces before your eyes. Ensorcelled before the disaster, you could do nothing to save anyone but yourself, watching the horror as if it were nothing but a bad dream.

Your refuge is the Salty Cormorant, an odd amalgamation of pirate and Navy vessel. There, you came fully back to your senses, and are filled with nothing but rage and pain. And you aren’t the only one. You, and the other 300 survivors, have been robbed of home and health, and there are others who would see it righted, or avenged. You are told that you sail for Precipice Port. A fortnight cannot pass soon enough. Until then, you will find out everything the crew of this strange ship knows, to find some clue about the terrible beast He. However, you are not alone in this pursuit. The evil that trapped your minds has followed you, and it is not done with you yet. 

Stilt-Sand Survivors is the first chapter in the new WildPig Exclusive Campaign "Vengeance at Sea" by Noah Anderson, set in the “Ten Isles” setting developed by Noah Anderson in association with the WildPig community. All players are welcome. Characters are 1st level, with a limit of 8 players per session. There will be time for character creation a half-hour before the first session. Seats are limited, so please register ahead of time.
results.name: D&D 5E: Vengeance at Sea Chapter 1 - Stilt-Sand Survivors

results.description:
5:00-5:15: Requisite fifteen minute schmoozing.
5:15-6:15: We write for an hour, a la the "Shut Up & Write" meetups.
6:15-6:25: Replenish mind and body after intense and gratifying writing session via the ordering of food and drink.
6:25-8:00: We critique, in a a supportive way, two pieces from group members. The two pieces will have been designated the previous week. These files are available through the "Files" section on this site.
8:00: Sad farewells, until next week.

We look forward to seeing you at the Sunday AWG Meetup. Any questions, please feel free to contact us through this site.

PLEASE NOTE: You must attend at least one meetup before submitting a piece for review.

PLEASE NOTE AGAIN: It's probably a good idea to bring headphones and a music player, as it's unpredictable what sort of background noise is going to be going on during the writing session.

All files to be critiqued on Sunday are available from the "Files" section, which is under the "More" Menu at the top of the page. The direct link to the "Files" page is:

http://www.meetup.com/astoriawritersgroup/files/

Rockin Sunday Run

& Then Drinks!

Latest Weather Forecast
For Sunday Afternoon:

Sunny around 60 Degrees

That's great weather for running and for
getting together afterwards for a
few drinks. Beautiful sunny skies
in the afternoon will make for great
viewing of the lake and park as we run.


Join us and have fun!

Our group is a group of runners,
of all running abilities,
who work in mostly professional fields.


Great people to run
and to socialize with.

When:

Sunday, March 27th, at 4:30 PM


I'll be wearing a black DGA
(Director's Guild of America)
baseball hat and I have blond hair.

That's me in the center: 



For The Run:

It's best to travel light, or wear
a backpack and throw your stuff in there.

The less you bring with you
the better it is. 

For New Members and
First Time Group Runners:


It's cool if you're not a speedy runner.
You won't be the only one.  Plus, after just your 
first run with us, the run and the running tips, 
will make you a better and faster runner.

Guaranteed.

After we run, and get our
metabolism into high gear,

We'll go to a nearby cool bar
and reward ourselves for our efforts.  

They have good food and drinks
that are inexpensive and tasty.

At every run, we always get a whole
bunch of new members who join us
and add to the mix.

If you have any questions
Shoot me a message.


It's going to be a fun.

See you on Sunday!

Marcello
(Organizer)

Rockin Sunday Run

& Then Drinks!


Don't miss the fun

Join us on Sunday 

March 27th


****

4v4 small goals

Fun Play

kick-ins.. no throw ins.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture
All proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If PS2G cancels a game, please go to this link ps2g.org/games/refund-request for a refund.

There is a minimum of 4v4 with 8 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.
