results.description:
To grace the launch of Jeff Carreira’s new work “THE SOUL OF A NEW SELF Embracing the Future of Being Human” please join us at 7PM on Monday, March 28, 2016 at Simple Studios 2nd Floor, 134 W 29th St, New York, NY 

Jeff Carreira will be with us in person to discuss and lead us in an exploration of his new work.

“The Soul of a New Self is an exploration of our sense of self, how it creates the reality we live in, and how we can change reality by changing the experience of who we are. Drawing on a wide range of contemporary and classical sources from David Byrne of the Talking Heads to the 18th century German Idealist Immanuel Kant, Jeff Carreira, explains that we are currently caught in an identity of separation and isolation from each other and the world. This book takes the reader step-by-step into the realization that we are part of an unfolding continuity – a wholeness that grows. As we embrace our potential for living in unity together we open into a new phase of existence.”

Available March,[masked], but Jeff should have advance copies at the event. A small donation will be collected for space rental costs. 

Endorsements for The Soul of a New Self:

“The Soul of a New Self is a message from the future, an invitation from an intrepid explorer who has dared to leave behind the familiar and explore the leading edges of humanity’s next evolutionary stage.” 
– Craig Hamilton, Spiritual teacher & founder of Integral Enlightenment 

Jeff has developed a unique and delightful narrative style, weaving a new kind of inquiry he calls “wormholing” with a personal account of his own journey and aspirations. His personal story draws us in as intimate partners in a deeply holistic universe of lived experience. His invitation to “wormhole” with him, helps us to examine the assumptions that underlay the metaphysical foundations of our existing paradigm that constrain all our current worldviews. This is as challenging as pointing out water to a fish – and yet Jeff guides us through his thought experiments with natural language and playful prodding. This gives us the opportunity to see the world through his enlightened eyes and experience his expansion of the ordinary self into a far greater possibility than we could ever know.

– Bonnitta Roy, Founder of Alderlore Insight Center, Associate Editor, Integral Review Journal, Program Coordinator, MA in Consciousness Studies, the Graduate Institute

This is an important book. In writing this Jeff Carreira is prompting us not only to find our individual enlightenment, not only to seek enlightenment collectively, not even to open ourselves to a higher source of wisdom, but to escape the limitations of our dimensionality and actually recognize the relational field as a being. Then to see not only that “I am that” but also we all are that, and “that”, now and forever, is the soul of the new Self.

– Dr. Jeffrey Eisen, author of Oneness Perceived and founder of The PsychoNoetics Science Institute

The Soul of a New Self explores the most vital question of our time: Who are we? Jeff Carreira’s passionate quest and response to this question moves me deeply. He describes his recognition that “I”, the being that I am right now, is the universe awakening to its own existence. Yet it is also true that the individual self is an expression of the universe in unique form. I love this book. It is worthy of true dialogue among us. I hope you will read it and that we will explore it together.

– Barbara Marx Hubbard, author of Conscious Evolution, and founder of The Foundation for Conscious Evolution

About the Author:

Jeff Carreira is no stranger to the Integral NY Community. He is a mystical philosopher, spiritual guide, and author who teaches meditation and transformative philosophy to a growing number of people throughout the world.


Jeff offers retreats and courses in a form of meditation he calls “The Practice of No Problem.” Through this simple and effective meditation technique Jeff has led thousands of people in the journey beyond the confines of fear and self-concern into the expansive liberated awareness that is our true home.

As a philosopher, Jeff is interested in defining a new way of being in the world that will move us from our current paradigm of separation and isolation into an emerging paradigm of unity and wholeness. He is exploring and teaching some of the most revolutionary ideas and systems of thought in the domains of spirituality, consciousness, and human development. He leads courses in this new understanding of reality and teaches people how to question their experience until previously held assumptions about the nature of reality fall away to create the space for a dramatically new understanding to emerge.

Jeff is passionate about philosophy because he is passionate about the power of ideas to shape how we perceive reality and how we live together. His enthusiasm for learning is infectious, and he enjoys addressing student groups and inspiring them to develop their own powers of inquiry.

Jeff is the author of six books. Three of these, The Miracle of Meditation, The Practice of No Problem, and Embrace All That You Are, clarify his teachings of meditation. The other three, Philosophy Is Not a Luxury, Radical Inclusivity, and The Soul of a New Self, offer a continuously expanding presentation of his philosophical investigations into the nature of reality and how it evolves.

Join us for our weekly figure drawing session at The National Arts Club.

This session is open to all levels. Open to the public.

<a>Let us know you're coming.</a> 


We operate on a first come first served basis. Arriving by 6:45 is a good way to guarantee a seat.

• Bring your own drawing supplies.


• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break.

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp!

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes.

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there.

Simon

results.description:
Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).

results.description:
Apply here: http://beginnerprogrammers.nyc/android-bootcamp/

Overview


Ever wanted to dive into the world of mobile development, or just make that app idea you're always telling your friends about? Take this 12 week bootcamp and we will explore the inner workings of the Android SDK. You will get a solid foundation of Java, the language of choice for Android. So that by the end of the course you will build a complete functioning Android Application ready for submission into the Google Play Store. So Take This Class, and enjoy changing your life!

Our Structure


Students will attend class 4 times weekly, while being given homework assignments and projects to work on outside of class. You will also have direct communication with each of your instructors and TA’s before, during, and after the bootcamp completes.


Our weekend Peer Programming events are also a great way to sharpen your programming skills and complete assignments amongst fellow coders.


Class Setup


The best educations come from small class sizes and direct instruction...period. You will be part of a class no larger than 10 students.


Preparing You for the Real World


Select students will be given immediate internship opportunities as an Android developer with some of the startups that we work with. During the final month of the boot camp, each student will spend time shadowing a developer at a tech startup to gain experience and interact with an actual developer.


We will also refer you to available positions through our extensive network after teaching you vital interviewing skills needed to be a self sufficient developer.

Pre-requisites

• No previous programming experience is required, but we would recommend you at least take one of our free appetizer courses on www.beginnerprogrammers.nyc

Please bring a laptop capable of running

IntelliJ

and  

Android Studio

Instructor: Bryan Okeke

Android Developer @ www.bytemark.co

Founder of Beginner Programmers: www.beginnerprogrammers.nyc

Organizer of: http://www.meetup.com/BeginnerProgrammers/

results.description:
One fabulous talk for our March meetup!

Ilia Blinderman

Title: Making People Care: Pairing Narrative with Visualization


Description: It's notoriously difficult to keep a reader's attention online, and ever-shortening attention spans are making this task even harder — particularly with larger projects. How, then, to ensure that your audience stays tuned in to the insights you're communicating with your analysis and visualizations? Using a case study which involved a detailed look at 10,000 Craigslist missed connections, we'll discuss ways to pair narrative with visualizations to sustain audience attention, as well as dive into the technical aspects of the project.  


Bio: Ilia Blinderman is an interactive data visualization designer and writer, with a background in psychological research.

Notes: If you're interested in grabbing a coffee and talking shop, feel free to get in touch through, [masked]

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.description:
Dear Friends & Troublemakers!


Let's step into our greatest adventure and live in the fullness of who we truly are - together! Let's release that which no longer serves us and liberate our true and greatest selves - open, vulnerable, infinite, loving and free!! Let's lean into our edges and our vulnerability.  Face our fears and leap into the unknown of our greatest yet to be!!! Let's play in the field of Great Spirit!!

Join us in a powerful and joyous group healing process that will allow you to release internal barriers to happiness, love, empowerment, liberation, joy, success and abundance with ease, grace, fun and laughter! Permanent positive change, expansion and growth occur as layers of repressed pain, fear, limiting beliefs, unhealthy behavior patterns and trauma are released from the body, mind and emotions in a process that combines elements of traditional counseling with a sacred transmission of the divine healing energy of Spirit - to release in one session that which takes years to heal in traditional therapeutic modalities. This all happens in a fun, loving, safe, supportive and completely confidential community setting that we will be recreating every other Monday night.   

Our work with our teachers Don and Jen Hanson http://www.donhanson.com/ has catalyzed truly momentous growth and transformation in our lives, and we feel blessed and grateful to now be certified to share this truly miraculous and amazing, love and light-filled healing journey with all who are interested in being liberated from that which holds them back in order to be all that it is their sacred destiny to be. We are relatable, real world folks who have discovered something that has so transformed our lives, for which we are so grateful, that we want to pass this on to as many people as possible. In keeping with the great mystical traditions, TCM opens hearts and minds, teaches tools, and builds internal structure that allow each participant to cultivate and build their own relationship with Spirit and Sacred Energy, and far from creating any dependency on us or the process, liberates all to deepen and follow the calling of their own unique relationship to Spirit.  
With Love, Marc Anthony

Marc Anthony  is a Certified TCM facilitator who has been trained by Don and Jen Hanson for almost a decade. He has been facilitating TCM groups in New York, Florida and Connecticut. Early on Marc Anthony devoted his life to the journey of self discovery and personal growth. Working with the Spirit and Divine Intelligence of the Universe he helps unlock and transform old beliefs, behavior patterns and resistance to allow a deeper connection with the Divine.  

In his work Marc Anthony also brings various modalities such as Tantra, Sacred Sexuality, Psychodrama, Bodywork and Energy Healing.  He is also an IIN graduate and a successful businessman,investor,entrepreneur and owns a Contracting and Management Company. He is also a father to a beautiful son Nicholas. Marc Anthony lives in New York City and New Jersey and is available for private healing sessions with individuals and couples.

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
and 12 – 1 pm before monthly Miracles in Manhattan lectures (usually 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
Add some variety to your running -- do some speed work on the track! Think you're slow? This is the best way to get faster. Nobody is too slow to try a track workout. This is how you will improve.

We encourage runners of all ability levels to join. You are not too slow! If you are a even a little bit intimidated by the thought of running laps at the track we want to challenge you to come join us and find out just how awesome it actually is. You will feel great (and exhausted) at the end of the workout. Guaranteed!


The East River Park Track is just across the FDR highway at the end of 6th street. Just walk across the pedestrian overpass and the track will be right there.


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. We pile all our stuff together and are (relatively) nearby for the duration of the workout. We have never had a problem with theft, but that doesn't mean it won't happen.


After the workout join us for beer at ABC Beer Co. at Ave C between 6th and 7th.

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/1OfHJbUUCYFprLIv1GV1RD7DfCKw99hJZpIurO4GjDRR9NcMcbF83b0qpebX_7TP-Y7_zSeD8Y5XDFOcWCDoxYPiETFDlyPFZ1mS4l0xLrkD94frXYh3wdau9nDuRS1TX7swsD76

https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/9hHdSi7bHSqjxkH7-n1gKyPdssqGleO02vZUi5qSzF-8sYiamfJwUm_UKuFWk__kzN8iPNcEn37FS57-SqWOArg1ktlueywzu_zsxyxsQEo_W0SWaw7wzs7RQQu1Xzm0AmP7GMTp Join Be Social Change on Monday, March 28th from 7 PM to 9 PM for Improv(e) Yourself: Using Improvisation to Conquer Public Speaking</a> with <a href="http://theengagingeducator.com/">The Engaging Educator.

In the US, public speaking is feared more than death. The reality is we all have to do it - and there is a difference between doing it and doing it well. So how do we get over it? We improvise!

===========================================

LIMITED TICKETS AVAILABLE! This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: http://bit.ly/BSCimprovMar28

===========================================

Improv is rooted in communication - listening, responding, focus, attention, flexibility - all of these skills are flexed in good improv. And we all need it - remember the Michael Bay Samsung breakdown? (Google it if you don’t!) Flexibility and the ability to “roll with it” are skills that can be taught, and an essential in public speaking.

But maybe you just want to work on your communication skills. Maybe you’ve always been curious about improv. Maybe you just want a fun night of class - improv helps you improve in all areas of your life - the worst that happens is you spend a night laughing a lot!

WHAT YOU’LL LEARN

• How improv connects to our everyday life.

• The start of a greater self awareness in conversation and presentation skills

• The beginnings of how to be more flexible, present, focused and attentive

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR   

• Professionals, entrepreneurs, creatives, and communications strategists/marketers who want to work on their communication skills in a fun way

• Professionals who want an increase in creativity and flexibility

INSTRUCTOR BIO

</a>

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/Rfn6U1iSX0rBUmM_iBWL1aoK0X1tm8Zwz6legFg_pmrLweSsLWwppPeV97Wu6GbIdj2v86LKgw5C-a5nTEvSsgB6ByvFwU0qxXrPij7QsLUAHoVXt4yAU9gxQA_FA5K5qQfVGa0

Realizing the connection between improvisation and communication, <a href="http://www.theengagingeducator.com/">The Engaging Educator (@TheEngagingEd), specializes in customized improv-based education. We provide classes that enhance public speaking, creativity, flexibility, positive risk-taking, teamwork and more by flexing improv muscles. Beyond our classes for educators and professionals, we also specialize in improv for high school students, corporate workshops, and improv for individuals on the autism spectrum, as well as individuals with cerebral palsy.

The Engaging Educator is a passionate and talented team of educators, facilitators and professionals. Each of our Engagers brings a distinct style and energy to our brand of "Yes, And," and all believe in the power of Improv as Continuing Education.


SPACE PARTNER


The Centre for Social Innovation (@csiSL) is a home for nonprofits and social entrepreneurs in New York City. They’re building a movement of passionate people committed to a better world. Learn more at http://nyc.socialinnovation.org/

Refund Policy: Refunds can be issued in full up to 48 hours prior to the start of the class by contacting Be Social Change.
results.name: BSC Class: Improv(e) Yourself - Improvisation for Public Speaking

results.description:
This is NOT the Shades of Grey you think it is...

Shades of Grey by Jasper Fforde

From Publisher's Weekly:


This inventive fantasy from bestseller Fforde (The Eyre Affair) imagines a screwball future in which social castes and protocols are rigidly defined by acuteness of personal color perception. Centuries after the cryptically cataclysmic Something That Happened, a Colortocracy, founded on the inflexible absolutes of the chromatic scale, rules the world. Amiable Eddie Russett, a young Red, is looking forward to marrying a notch up on the palette and settling down to a complacent bourgeois life. But after meeting Jane G-23, a rebellious working-class Grey, and a discredited, invisible historian known as the Apocryphal man, Eddie finds himself questioning the hitherto sacred foundations of the status quo. En route to finding out what turned things topsy-turvy, Eddie navigates a vividly imagined landscape whose every facet is steeped in the author's remarkably detailed color scheme. Sometimes, though, it's hard to see the story for the chromotechnics. 
Copyright © Reed Business Information, a division of Reed Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

 ~Please be courteous by ordering food and/or drinks at the venue. 
~THERE IS A $2 FEE for this event; this goes towards the Meetup organizer fee. 
~RSVPs will be open until midnight the day before the event. I will also send out my cell number to those attending.

Looking forward to seeing you there!

~Hazel

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there.
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
March's book is All Who Go Do Not Return by Shulem Deen:

Shulem Deen was raised to believe that questions are dangerous. As a member of the Skverers, one of the most insular Hasidic sects in the US, he knows little about the outside world—only that it is to be shunned. His marriage at eighteen is arranged and several children soon follow. Deen's first transgression—turning on the radio—is small, but his curiosity leads him to the library, and later the Internet. Soon he begins a feverish inquiry into the tenets of his religious beliefs, until, several years later, his faith unravels entirely. Now a heretic, he fears being discovered and ostracized from the only world he knows. His relationship with his family at stake, he is forced into a life of deception, and begins a long struggle to hold on to those he loves most: his five children.

Friendly reminders that a) there is a $2 fee collected upon arrival and b) any & all suggestions for future books are always welcome! Leave a comment here and/or message me directly with ideas; I keep a running list and will send out another poll later in the spring. :)

Minal Mehta is the Co-Founder and President of BOLLYX. She has a fitness background in competitive synchronized swimming, water polo and swimming, and an artistic background in various styles of dance, including Bollywood, Kathak, jazz, Indian folk, and hip hop. Minal was at the forefront of Bollywood dance exploding in collegiate competitions nationwide, leading her UC Berkeley Bollywood dance team (Aao Na) to sweep all national competitions in 2005. Minal is an AFAA certified group fitness instructor and teaches BOLLYX classes in NYC.  Minal graduated from UC Berkeley in 2005 with a B.A. in Economics with Honors and from Harvard Business School in 2011 with an M.B.A in general management.

results.description: The purpose of this group is to establish a safe place where people can deal with the pain and isolation brought about by the ending of a significant relationship. We are not a singles group or a dating network. Instead, we are a family where it is safe to be ourselves. The goal of the meeting is to help members to develop into healthier, more complete, independent, loving men and women. We hope that by being together, listening to each other, and by sharing our experiences, strength and hope, we will learn to see the value of life in a new context. For the first hour of each meeting members share their experiences. The second half of the meeting is reserved for a guest speaker relating to either the legal or emotional aspects of separation/divorce. We meet every Monday eveing at the Church in the Highlands, 35 Bryant Ave. White Plains, New York. We are a mixed group of men and women. There are about 50 members, with approximately 20 attendees per meeting. There are no fees, new members are welcome, no reservation is necessary. We pass a basket at each meeting and suggest a five dollar donation per meeting to cover the cost of the meeting place and coffee/cookies served at the meeting.
results.name: Separation and Divorce Recovery Group Weekly Meetup

results.description:
Community Circling Nights have a lively and supportive atmosphere and are intended to bring community together in a group setting to experience each other and different facilitators in one evening.

The evening will begin promptly at 7:30 pm for BOTH Experienced Circlers and Newcomers

$25 paid in-advance online
$30 at the door

To Register: http://communitycircling.eventbrite.com/

Wake up to whole new relational spaces and touch into parts of yourself that bring a deep nourishment and inspiration.

Times below are approximate:

7:30 pm - Group Connection and Check-Ins
7:50 - Newcomers Learning Session
7:50 - Experienced Circlers break into circles
8:35 - Break
8:50 - Circle 2 (mixing new and experienced circlers)
9:30 - Break
9:40 - Circling 3 (mixing new and experienced circlers)
10:20 - Closing exercise
10:25 - announcements

Please be punctual and check-in prior to 7:30 pm in order to support the flow of the evening. Late arrivers may need to wait until the second circle to join if the first circle has already begun.

Community Circling Nights will be facilitated by trained Circlers

If you can't make it to a Community Circling Night, join us at a Circling Lab, a smaller more intimate experience occuring weekly Mondays at Reflections: http://circling.eventbrite.com/


Community Circling Nights:
$25 Advance Payment online
$30 At the door
> PRE-PAY HERE: http://communitycircling.eventbrite.com/

What’s it like to experience Circling?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmIhCf06Osg

What are the benefits of Circling?

Circling is a fresh way to develop presence and richer connections with those around you. It can provide fundamental and often unseen insights that, once seen, create new and exciting opportunities. It provides a doorway into flow experiences and breathes life into sometimes vague spiritual concepts and ideas.

Through Circling individuals can start to develop trust in a deeper intelligence in themselves and others. Part of what makes it special is that, although it is based on complex ideas, it is simple and empowering to take part in. We believe it to be one of the richest tools for human development in the world today because it works on so many levels.

What is Circling?

Circling is a practice where the attention of a small group is skillfully focused on an individual. This person gets to feel the impact of being supportively seen by others while also experiencing their honest in the moment feelings. The process revolves around connection, understanding and a deep authenticity between people. It involves bringing a greater awareness and appreciation into our connections with others and can be considered a relational meditation because of this. It is a paradigm-shifting practice that is supported by wide ranging research in how adults learn and develop. For more about information about Circling visit AuthenticWorld.com or www.circlingeurope.com


REGISTER HERE: http://communitycircling.eventbrite.com/

$25 In-advance online
$30 At the door

Questions about Circling and Authentic Relating NYC?
Contact Amy at: [masked]

Reflections Center for Conscious Living
227 E 24th Street (between 3rd and 2nd)

results.description:
We will be discussing the contents of The World Peace Diet, Chapters 7 and 8: 

• Chapter 7: The Domination of the Feminine;

“Milk was destined to feed the animal’s offspring and not that man should take it with force for himself. The kid has the right to enjoy its mother’s milk and its mother’s love, but hard-hearted man, influenced by his materialistic and shallow outlook, changes and perverts these true functions. Thus the gentle kid is unable to partake of its mother’s love and rejoice in the splendor of life.” —Rabbi Abraham Kook, Chief Rabbi of Israel,

• Chapter 8: The Metaphysics of Food

“All beings tremble before violence. All fear death. All love life. See yourself in others. Then whom can you hurt? What harm can you do?” —Buddha

The World Peace Diet provides a transformative perspective on the multiple consequences of the food choices we make (or are made for us)—not just in terms of personal physical health, but also environmental health, cultural, economic, ethical and spiritual well-being too.

If you have read the book, this study group will be a good forum for sharing sections that meant something to you, changed the way you perceive the world or the way you interact with the world,

If you have not read the book but are an ethical and environmentally compassionate individual, and would like to explore ways to live more in alignment with your values, I think you will enjoy the discussion and be a valuable contributor.

Remaining chapters will be discussed in the following weeks.

results.description:
This group is dedicated exclusively to novels. Please read the Novel Group Intro and FAQ before attending.  Be prepared to read back through previous chapters of a novel-in-progress before committing to this group.

HOW MEMBERS SUBMIT NOVEL SECTIONS:


Email your submission to [masked]

SUBJECT: The Title of the group you're submitting to and your name. EXAMPLE: Cam's Novel Group December 8th, Spidercam
MESSAGE: Name, Title, Word Count, any additional info. EXAMPLE: Spidercam, Glory Chapter 2, 7,000 words. This is a rewrite.
Send to [masked]

Attach your document. RTF and DOC are preferred. Please, NO PDF's or DOCx. 


What to Expect: Nine days before the meeting you will receive an email from Meetup with links to download each story for critique from our Dropbox account. Click on the link and download the stories.

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next. You can find advice about how to give a critique here.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!
results.name: Marcus's Novel Group

For more info, email Karin T or Linda D.


Playing the rehearsal CD in the car, at home, while doing household duties --- helps imprint the tonal relationships in the brain and ear, so your voice knows where to go and when. For when you don't have time to sit down and follow the score visually, it DOES help... subliminal training.

VISITORS: TENOR and BASS voices are needed to balance our strong alto and soprano sections. We have a wonderful fun group of men here at TRS! While it is too late to join up for this spring 2016 season, singers are invited to COME SAMPLE A REHEARSAL anytime... if you enjoy, you can sing in the next singing season (two concerts a year: Sept-Dec, and Jan-May). 

For more information, send a message to Linda D; click on PAGES tab above, and "About Us" at top of lefthand column.

Please: No scented products of any kind (allergies).

Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014


"It's like looking into the eyes of Pure Love. I've been around meditation, acupuncture, and "Spiritual Healers" for over 20 years. In that time I've worked with several healers. Not until I had privilege of meeting Nan Ni did I experience a true healer. Having a session with Nan Ni or "Nan" is like looking into the eyes of Pure Love - the kind of selfless Love that you hoped was "out there", but didn't really expect to find. Nan has a profound sense of commitment to her patients and students. Her caring, genuine smile comes from deep within and warms you the moment that you meet her. Nan's healing, insightful ways never cease to amaze me and fill me with gratitude. Nan can look at you and know what you need. How many times was I shocked when, without my uttering a word, did she know exactly was what troubling me. I wish I were eloquent enough to express my sincere appreciation for the gift of meeting and working with Nan. Nan's answer to that would be to greet each and every person I meet with an open and loving heart. It is my hope that if you are searching for a healer and/or a meditation practice and come across these words, that you will know that you've found what you've been searching for. Thank you, Lynn" Bodhi Meditation Class Saturday March 14, 2014 “ Very strong healing energy tonight. I got there feeling very tired. I had stomach pain all day, and during the first meditation of the evening it got a lot better. By the end I wasn't thinking about it at all. I left full of energy. ” Pam, Bodhi Meditation class November 22, 2013

“ I didn't realize I would be reaping the benefits of Bodhi Med so quickly after attending only two classes. After my second class I felt even more relaxed. I have insomnia, but after the second session I fell asleep faster and deeper which has not happened for a long time. ” Dee, Bodhi Meditation class September 18, 2013

It was enlightening!!! Every time I practice Bodhi meditation, it feels like my Chi increases more and more! Thank you everyone for sharing this to NYC." Javoski (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"Nan emits healing energy -- the meditation is wonderful" Linda (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) "Very calming and energizing. I did not have any negative thoughts or worries last night in bed like I always do. I felt my mind was clear. I will definitely go to another class" Dee (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"I Walked In With Lower Back Pain, Listened, Opened My Heart And Relaxed My Mind And Walked Out Feeling Better Than I Have In Almost Two Weeks. Thank You So Much. Looking Forward To Friday's " Ed (Bodhi Meditation class Tuesday July 30, 2013)

--------------------------------------------------------------------

Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness
* Stronger emotional intelligence
* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation

Energize your body

Strenthen your mind

Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated
* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America


Time:. 7:30 PM – 9:00 PM

Day: Mondays

Where: Room #102, Freeport Recreation Center

130 E Merrick Rd, Freeport, NY 11520

Contact: Nan, [masked]

**The Bodhi Meditation classes at the Freeport Rec Center Monday nightsare free but all participates are required to have a Freeport Rec Center Activity Card.  The cost is $5.00 for Freeport Residents and $10.00 for Non-Residents. It's a one time annual fee payable to the Freeport Rec Center. If it's your first class please arrive early to purchase your activity card.

 -------------------------------------------------------------------

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.

results.description:
Cuddle Party is a 3 hour workshop experience where participants engage in communication exercises, explore touch in a non-sexual space, experience personal exploration and intimacy, and have fun with like minded friends from the community.

Nurturing and consensual loving touch is good for maintaining healthy blood pressure, a strong nervous system and a balanced emotional health. One’s ability to connect with and develop greater trust in others is emphasized during the group exchanges during Cuddle Party’s. Self-care is a cornerstone of Cuddle Party experience.

As seen on CBS’s the DR’S - http://thedoctorstv.com/videolib/init/6154

Cuddle Party is a formal, non-sexual event that offers participants an opportunity to explore intimacy with like-minded others. In a relaxed environment, that upholds personal boundaries and maintains a professional atmosphere, at all times, one is encouraged to engage in communication and touch, in a non-threatening, share-affirming environment.

Cuddle Party is a holistic, social environment, that attracts fascinating people from all walks of life. It provides a special and unique opportunity for connection, learning and growth. Come cuddle with us!

About Cuddle Party from Monique:

I have facilitated 100′s of Cuddle Parties. I am as passionate about the Cuddle Party experience today, as I was the first one, over five years ago. YES! It helped me reclaim my voice and I am passionate about helping others do the same.

Cuddle Party experiences teach participants, they alone create their own safety container. How did it change my life? When I was growing up and received a NO, it felt like I was being rejected. The result was my emphasis on being nice, being lovable and being unconditionally available. The profound learning came when I realized my unyielding YES’s became a subconscious inability to trust another person’s YES, without their own personally vocalized NO!

I am very appreciative and honored by the courage shown by those who have clear boundaries, and an ability to voice their YES and NO decisions without guilt, shame or fear. It gives me the confidence to ask for what my own heart desires, instead of censoring myself, knowing the receiver of my request has the voice and courage to embrace or withdraw, based on their own perimeters. “Thank you for taking care of your self”

After the Welcome Circle, Reid will offer a mini version of his speed flirting class, to help break the ice and dive us into getting to know one another.

Speed-Flirting is a rambunctious, social event for men, women, humans of all ages. The usual definition of flirting as just “a sexual thang” limits our ability to engage with people playfully. What if flirting meant “increasing the fun and play in any interaction?” Perfect for singles, couples, and entire communities, Speed-Flirting gives us the tools to go deeper than just a wink and a smile… Speed-Flirting will teach you to:

Break the ice with ease and confidence.

Make your dating and relationship life pressure-free.

Say No without feeling guilty.

Keep people from misunderstanding your intentions.

Relate with rejection gracefully and leave people feeling better for having met you.

Get anyone to make the first move.

Join sex and relationship educator Reid Mihalko (creator of the pop-culture phenomenon Cuddle Party) for an exciting and comical evening of flirtation. Add more aliveness to your existing relationships. Make new friends in the most exciting way possible. Speed-Flirting features a series of structured games and exercises with lots of easy-to-apply tools for breaking the ice, overcoming awkward moments, and for deep-connection through play. IMPORTANT CUDDLE PARTY NOTES:

BRING: Comfortable PJS, Blankets, Pillows and any kind of soft fluff to enhance your experience.

PLEASE BE ON TIME: Make certain to account FOR TRAFFIC AND PARKING.

Doors lock at 8:15. The opening Welcome Circle is for introductions and to go over the rules of Cuddle Party. This is an important aspect of the Cuddle Party experience and creates a safe container for all participants. It is essential that everyone be on time.

Love Exchange $40 per person
RSVP HERE: https://speedflirtny.eventbrite.com
Tickets are $45 per person at the door (IF not sold out)

About Your Facilitators:
Monique Darling, workshop facilitator extraordinaire has led over 800 workshops in the past 5 years. She is the founder of Juicy Enlightenment an organization dedicated to empowering people who are questioning the assumptions of how their life should be and to offering tools for self expression that create trust, inner knowing and wisdom to enjoy the life they have. Monique has been featured on TLC and The Dr’s as well as various radio shows, podcasts and magazines across the USA. She specializes in helping others reclaim their power and natural sensuality by transmuting fear and repression into courage, self-love and freedom. Her primary purpose is helping folks bring out their vulnerability, energetic embodiment and fearless relating.She guides from a place of understanding and her natural exuberance is infectious! She is available for private sessions, experiential workshops and Cuddle Parties. Learn more about Monique by going to juicyenlightenment.com or track her whereabouts at whereintheworldismoniquedarling.com

Sex and relationship expert Reid Mihalko teaches adults how to create more self-esteem, self-confidence and greater health and satisfaction in and out of the bedroom.

Using humor, insight and solid information, Reid appeals to audiences of all orientations, backgrounds, ages and identities. He’s one of the only male sex and relationship experts touring the country today who can speak pragmatically to nearly all areas of sexual self-expression, intimacy, dating and relating. Reid’s mission is to give men and women new tools to transform their love lives into fulfilling, satisfying, and sustainable expressions of self.
Reid has appeared on CBS’ The Doctors, Oprah’s Our America with Lisa Ling on OWN, Bravo’s Miss Advised, the Emmy award-winning talk show Montel, Fox News, VH1, Showtime’s Penn & Teller’s Bulls**t!, on NPR, Sirius’ Maxim Radio and Cosmo Radio, and in Marie Claire, GQ, Details, Seventeen, People, Newsweek, The Washington Post and The National Enquirer, as well as media across the globe in twenty-seven countries and at least fourteen languages.

Reid has also been a writer and producer on a number of films and television projects about sex and relationships, and consults regularly behind the scenes with producers and writers as an expert on subjects ranging from infidelity and sex addiction to dating and marriage, from jealousy and non-monogamy to gender dynamics and sexual tips and tricks.

For Reid, the skills it takes to make relationships healthy and turn mediocre sex into great sex are learnable by everyone. The question is: Do you have the courage to be the change you want to see in the bedroom?

Follow Reid on Twitter at @ReidAboutSex
results.name: Speed Flirting & Official Cuddle Party w founder Reid Mihalko & Monique Darling

results.description:
What if accessing your desire is the thing that can truly give you fulfillment? What if real health and deep intimate relationships only comes from a life lived in accordance with what your body wants? Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC? We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

results.description:
Hello Friends, The New York City chapter of the Democratic Socialists of America will be sending a team, the Bowlsheviks, to the NY Abortion Access closing event on Sunday, April 10th at Bowlmore Lanes at Chelsea Pier 60). This particular event aims to raise $100,000 to go directly to the
New York Abortion Access Fund. Only heavy balls - and generous donations - will combat such a heavy topic.

Some of you maybe be wondering why New York would need such a fund, since the state is considered one of the most liberal when it comes to abortion services. Decades before Roe V Wade, New York was a destination for women in need of safe abortions and will continue to be, especially for women from Pennsylvania where the state's restrictions on abortions went into effect last December. Furthermore, 12% of New York women live in counties with no abortion providers. The money you donate will be helping women from New York and other states, fund their procedure, travel and lodging so they can get the help they need.

We are having a fundraiser at grassroots tavern to raise money for the event. Please join us to learn more about abortion access and donate whatever you can for the cause. Grassroots tavern is a very chill dive bar with pop corn, cheap drinks and dart boards!!!

Also, if you cannot make it to the event, please donate here:
http://bowlathon.nnaf.org/teampage.asp?fundid=4372

results.description:
Mondays from 8 – 9:30 pm with Yasuko Kasaki & Chris Pelham

A Course in Miracles and A Course of Love classes are $20 each

Know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation clearly. Communicate with your Inner Teacher. Heal yourself and others.

These ongoing classes focus on mind training designed to help you to experience the lessons and wisdom of ACIM. 

Each Monday class contains some lecture from the ACIM Textbook and/or Urtext, some discussion and Q&A, and typically 20 – 30 minutes of meditation, creative visualization and/or spiritual reading practice in order to experience mind change.

Thursday classes skip the lecture to devote more time to discussion and practice.

Our primary goal in these classes is for each student to learn to listen to the guidance of Holy Spirit and live his/her life with certainty and peace. Slowly, you will re-train your eyes to see the world around you without judgment. You will learn to communicate with your holy spirit.

It is OK to attend without having done the reading, but we highly encourage you to do the reading (and the workbook lessons on your own) if you can! This course is meant to be experienced rather than simply talked about. You can find the text online here, among other places.

Students of all experience levels and backgrounds are welcome!

Yasuko Kasaki has been teaching A Course in Miracles and offering spiritual counseling and healing since 1999. She has approximately 1,000 students and clients. In 2004, she opened CRS, the first and only spiritual center in New York City devoted to the study and practice of ACIM. Ms. Kasaki is the author of 21 books published by major publishers in Japan. Read more...

You can listen to a sampling of Yasuko's recent guided meditations here:
http://crsny.podbean.com

Christopher Pelham currently serves as teaching assistant for the Monday class and will sometimes lead the group when Ms. Kasaki is away. He is the Director and a co-founder of CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing). He balances his time between overseeing the growth and health of the CRS community, producing arts/cultural/educational events at the Center, and working as a CRS Healer and student and teacher of A Course in Miracles. In addition to studying ACIM with Yasuko Kasaki since 2003, he studied the Spiritual Psychology of Acting with London-based teacher John Osborne Hughes and Keith Johnstone-based Improvisation with the late Gloria Maddox. Read more...

Another great way to get a taste of our approach is to attend one of our free Healing Events, each of which is open to the public:

Spiritual Healing Clinic 
M 7 – 7:50 pm, Tu 7 – 7:50 pm
Sundays 12 – 1 pm preceding Jon Mundy's Miracles in Manhattan lectures
Healing Clinic suggested donation $20, nobody turned away

Guided Meditation
Tu 6:30 – 7 pm
Free!

Easter’s done so it’s time to start sinning again. But first: comedy! COMEDY SHOW DETAILS BELOW!

results.description:
Please register for Low-latency ingestion and analytics with Apache Kafka and Apache Apex (Hadoop) on Mar 28,[masked]:00 PM at: 

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/6144492461887443972

This talk will cover a fully fault tolerant, scalable, and operational ingestion from Kafka using Apache Apex application, running natively in Hadoop. The talks will deep dive into technical details of the connectors in Apache Malhar. Details of production use cases will also be discussed. 

Agenda

9:00pm - Countdown for webinar 

9:15pm - Talk #1 will present how Apache Apex consumes from Kafka topics for real-time time processing and analytics. We will cover the features of the Apex Kafka Connector, which is one of the most popular operators in the Apex Malhar operator library, and powers several production use cases. We will explain the advanced features this operator provides for high throughput, low latency ingest and how it enables fault tolerant topologies with exactly once processing semantics. 

10:00pm - Q&A 

10:15pm - Talk #2 covers recently added support in Apache Apex Malhar for the new Kafka 0.9 consumer API. We will cover how the new API has simplified certain aspects of the connector, performance and scalability considerations when consuming data from Kafka with Apache Apex, interoperability with MapR streams and plans for future enhancements 

10:45pm - Q&A 

11:00pm - Demo 

11:15pm - Q&A 

Speakers:

- Siyuan Hua, committer of Apache Apex 

- Thomas Weise, committer and PPMC member of Apache Apex. A Hadoop veteran 

After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the webcast.
results.how_to_find_us: It is an online Webcast
results.name: Low-latency ingestion and analytics with Apache Kafka and Apache Apex (Hadoop)

results.description:
Do you own your own business? Are you starting a new business? Are you a very seasoned business professional? Do you want to get MOVING on your 2016 Biz-Goals right now?!


No matter what the answer to any of those questions, we have the meeting for you: New Frontier-26 (Manhattan BNI Chapter 26). We are a group of 37 (and growing!) NYC-based top-notch business-owners and business-development professionals who are all committed to helping grow each others' businesses. We launched less than 7 months ago and will be 80 members by August 1st! That's a promise.


Our Motto: Givers Gain.


The more we give to each other, the more the large group gives back to us! We allow one person per professional-classification (e.g. Social-Media expert, SEO, Graphic Designer, Photographer, and tons more) to actually JOIN our group.....but EVERYONE is invited to visit!


You will get the opportunity to stand and give a short under 1-minute commercial that gives the entire group of members and visitors a simple example of what they should be listening for.  And who they know! We typically have about 10 visitors per meeting, so that's an audience of 45-55 people you're talking to before 9am!


Visitors to our meeting typically walk away with any or all of the following:

• Leads/Referrals on possible new deals

• Contacts in professions they didn't know before but needed, and best of all....

• A full stomach! (Our meetings have delicious hot-eggs, bacon, fruit, bagels, yogurt.....and coffee. Lots and lots of coffee!)


We meet every Tuesday morning (except holidays) from 7am - 8:45am here: Sinigual Restaurant
41st and 3rd Ave
(640 Third Ave)
Manhattan New York, NY 10017


Cost: $20 per Visit (cash or credit-card)


When the structured part of the meeting ends at 8:40, there'll be plenty of time to talk to anyone in an "open-networking" ennvironment afterwards!

If you have business-cards, you can pass them around. We recommend bringing a stack of at least 40! But if you don't have business-cards yet....don't worry! The people who you want to talk with and who want to talk with you....you'll get all the opportunity you need.

That's all! If you're ready to get more accomplished on a Tuesday morning than you ever have before, come visit New Frontier-26, the ultimate Manhattan networking group.

(Note: your office or territory does not need to be in Manhattan to attend....ALL professionals)

results.description:
Professional Business Networking Event in Elmhurst, Queens.

The BNI Dream Team. 

As a reminder here's why we wake up early Tuesday mornings. 98% of businesses rely on referrals to build new business. ONLY 3% of businesses have a strategy to generate those referrals. Our BNI networking meetings are a proven word of mouth marketing referral generating strategy. Last year, members of BNI (Business Networking International) passed millions of referrals that generated billions of dollars of business for each other. Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of salespeople representing your business, and in return you are representing their businesses. What goes around comes around. If I help you, you’ll help me and we will both benefit as a result.

The reason  BNI is so successful is that there is only one person per profession per chapter. If your profession is listed below we invite you to come check us out and show you how we can help you grow your business.

BNI Dream Team is currently looking for these professions to pass a boat load of business to. 

IT Professional, Title Insurance, Moving Company, Reverse Mortgage Broker, DJ Entertainment Company, Florist, Photographer, Caterer, General Contractor, Event Planner, Personal Trainer, Architect, Hair Salon, Nutritionist, Life Coach, Commercial Real Estate Broker, Business Broker.

If your profession falls under any of the above titles I strongly encourage you to come check us out!

Here are the details for our next meeting Tuesday, October 20th 2015

Meeting time is from 7:00AM to 8:30AM

Our Location: Nevada Diner 80-26 Queens Blvd, Elmhurst, NY 11374 (718) 426-2229.

Plenty of Parking, trains: M & R, Grand Ave station

The cost is $15 which includes breakfast.

Please bring 30 business cards to pass out.

STOP LETTING BUSINESS PASS YOU BY AND TAKE ACTION NOW!

Come once, bring a thick stack of business cards with you, and make more quality professional contacts in the local community. It is a great way to get visibility for you and your business locally. We are BNI-affilliated, and value the philosophy of "Givers Gain". We are committed to help one-another succeed. Somewhat like having a part-time sales/marketing/mentoring/resource team. If you will. "If I help you, you'll want to help me, and we'll both benefit".

RSVP now and come promote your business at an upcoming Tuesday morning meeting!

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.


We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.

We are excited to partner with FinDEVr for its first ever east coast event (we already love the Finovate conference that they host here in the fall)!  Register now at newyork2016.findevr.com! - you must follow this link to register, meetup registration is not sufficient.

FinDEVr New York 2016 will take place at the beautiful New World Stages in Manhattan. FinDEVr is the only conference series that focuses on the builders (developers, coders, software architects, CTOs, VPs of Engineering, etc.) of innovative financial, banking and payments technology.


With an innovative dual-track format spanning two days, FinDEVr New York will blend fast-paced content with just the right amount of high-quality networking in order to provide maximum value to presenters and attendees. Each presenter has 15 minutes on stage in one of two 350-seat auditoriums to showcase their latest tools, technologies, APIs, platforms, case studies and tutorials. Register now at newyork2016.findevr.com! - you must follow this link to register, meetup registration is not sufficient.

About Byte Academy:  Byte Academy is an industry-focused coding bootcamp in the heart of Manhattan offering full and part-time programs emphasizing Python programming language. Programs include: fullstack Python development, FinTech (financial technology), Data Science and MedTech (medical technology). Byte Academy is the first coding camp in New York City to offer a full-time Python program and is the only in the world to teach FinTech. The school has small classes, career services and placement including access to top industry professionals and events. Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive a $2,000 off tuition upon acceptance to the program. Through Byte Academy's Tuition-Deferral Program, qualified applicants pay $0 until they find a job. Byte Academy is now accepting applications for its Part-Time Fullstack Python, FinTech and Data Science Classes!

results.description:
A mix is a great way to showcase your talent, the tracks that get you bumping and the tracks that have inspired you on the path of DJ-ing. So think of the bedroom as your house of worship. Honor it, pay reverence to it and give us a damn good mix worthy of the pantheon of the DJ gods on Mt. Olympus.

Some common ground rules to ensure a quality mix and ensure serious commitment:

•  House, deep-house, tech-house, techno, minimal, EDM or any other genre that fits into the house category.

• High quality mp3/wav 320kbps.

• Record a 1 hour mix without peaks, in other words; no clipping!

• Transitions need to be well segued, near flawless

• Sample mix required to ensure DJ commitment and whether or not you make the cut for the radio show

• A great profile pic

So once you’ve ticked all these off the list, you’re on your way to getting your DJ mix broadcasted. We’re especially reaching out to our new and beginning DJ's looking to make their mark. Send us a link where we can download your mix. Send us a profile picture too, so we can add it to the visual in case your mix has been selected for the weekly broadcast on Saturday (soundboxonline.com). Also check out Carl J and ADG presents where you can find all of our mixes back. Looking forward to hearing some great mixes.

Ayelmer Veenstra --- LMR

A.D.G.

results.description:
We will do cold readings of plays in progress and short pieces from 1 to 2pm and then from 2 to 3pm -- if you are an actor pressed for time that day, please let me know if 1pm or 2pm works better for you, and I will try to accommodate your needs! I want you to be able to participate with ease. 

At 3pm, we write til 4pm with a prompt. If you are only coming to write, please come by 3pm so we can start on time without interruptions. If you have paid in advance for the workshop, and you can't attend a writing session, the prompt will be sent to your email, so make sure I have your email. If you have a piece to be read, please try to send it to me via email in advance with a character breakdown to help me with casting. 

You are also free to cast your own piece -- you may not cast yourself in your piece. Give yourself the chance to honor your writing by listening to it as a writer. You may know exactly how you want it done, but that doesn't necessarily help you as a writer. Trust me on this, or ask me about it -- I am happy to discuss it with you. You can also bring in a piece and ask to have it read, and we'll read it cold. 

Please check your piece for time! Each writer gets up to ten minutes of material. This usually means ten pages if you write in accepted format with 12 point Courier font and your pages are not full of monologues. Monologues read longer than a minute a page. So time your work. 

Write Now Workshop is free for actors, but writers pay a fee that I am trying to reduce by 1) opening the workshop up to the community for free as a model for creating community and involvement and offering content to seniors who live nearby and 2) using a space that doesn't cost me a fortune (most of the fees are space fees) and 3) applying for funding as we grow and documenting the way the concept works and 4) having the workshop subsidized by patrons of the arts (already happening so that I can offer it at the current rate). 

The writers fees are currently $35 per session or $30 in advance for 9 workshops at $270 payable by cash or check or paypal to [masked]


Thank you!
Emma
results.name: Read Plays, Respond, and Write!

Making a career switch can be a thrilling and daunting task for many. results.description:
Six Summit Gallery presents an evening with two sculptors, Ailene Fields and Gina Novendstern, at their beautiful NYC studio overlooking the Chelsea skyline. Fields and Novendstern have shared a studio for over two decades, yet have distinct artistic visions. Fields' sculpture is influenced by mythology and fairy tales, as well as architectural spaces. Novendstern's sculpture focuses on the human form and the social,political and spiritual world we inhabit. Spending time at these artists' studio, surrounded by their finished works and works in progress, is an experience not to be missed.

https://www.facebook.com/events/981361655291876/


AILENE FIELDS is a sculptor known for her skills in stone, bronze and acrylic. Her sculptures are influenced by mythology,fairy tales and architectural spaces. She is the creator of the Baba Yaga Eats series recently displayed in multiple venues in the Meat Packing District and at New York Fashion Week in the Angel Orensanz Center. Fields has had solo museum exhibits at The Bergen Museum in Paramus, NJ and The Appleton Museum of Art in Ocala, FL., and solo gallery exhibits atThe CFM Gallery and The Sherry French gallery in New York, NY; Roslyn Sailor Fine Arts in Margate, NJ; The Broadhurst Gallery in Pinehurst, NC; and The Southern Vermont Art Center in Manchester, VT. In 2009 CFM Gallery published a book about her work, "Out Of The Nowhere Into The Here." Her sculptures can be seen in several galleries in the United States, including Six Summit Gallery. On the web her work can be seen at http://shop.sixsummitgallery.com/

GINA NOVENDSTERN is a sculptor whose work is exhibited internationally in museums and galleries, and can be found in both public and private collections. Her sculpture focuses on the human form and incorporates stone, steel and wood elements to give distinct expression to the figurative forms within each work. The Macay Museum of Contemporary Art in Mexico presented an exhibit of twenty-three of Novendstern's sculptures in 2008, and also produced a public television documentary about her. More recently, Novendstern was one of the artists chosen to represent the United States in an exhibit at the National Gallery of Fine Art in the Dominican Republic. Her sculpture can be seen in musuems and galleries in both the United States and Mexico, including Six Summit Gallery. On the web her work can be seen at http://users.arczip.com/gnovendstern and www.facebook.com/GinaNovendstern and shop.sixsummitgallery.com

results.description:
Updated March 7th, 2016

Given the warmth that has descended upon NYC, I am making Tuesdays/Thursdays active again, but at 5pm.

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside and Booker T Washington as backups.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

BOOKER T. WASHINGTON DETAILS

This location is between 107th & 108th Streets just West of Columbus Avenue. It's on the backside of the high school. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. 

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

Greetings Everyone!

Thanks to everyone who attended the previous session (see pics) on Large Scale Scrum Discussion on March 15th.

Our next meetup is scheduled for March 29th: same place & same time.
You can RSVP here or at:
http://www.meetup.com/Large-Scale-Scrum-LeSS-in-NYC/events/229733065/

Based on the volume and type of questions, in the next session we will take a deeper dive into the discussion of Component Teams vs. Feature Teams (need to understand difference between Local vs. System optimization). We shall also make use of Casual Loop Diagrams to better visualize our discussion.

There will be fewer slides and more interactive wall drawing in this session (thanks to Nureva system available to us during meet-ups).

If you have not been exposed or practiced LeSS, it would be great to review LeSS highlights here: https://less.works/

Note: If you are interested in a full 3-day Large Scale Scrum Practitioner Course, taught by Craig Larman (LeSS co-founder) in NYC on April 6-8th, please follow this link (there are still a few seats left).

See you soon,

gene
results.name: Agility at Scale: Component vs. Feature Teams in LeSS
